title: Functional Dynamics CRM Contractor
description:
**Title:** Functional Dynamics CRM Contractor  
**Location:** Washington DC  
**Remote:** Travel onsite up to **4 to 5** days in a row one time per month. **(Non Negotiable)** 

**Candidate has to manage the travel expenses for being onsite. The client will not reimburse the expenses.** 

**Job Description:**  
We are looking for a functional Dynamics CRM Contractor that’s technical as well. This is on D365, the latest version. This application is for Child Welfare and will contain the following modules: Intake, Investigation, Case Management, Services, Providers, Finance, and Reporting. This person will be a Technical product owner looking at user stories and interfacing with the developers. User Stories will cross ALL modules that are listed above. User Stories may also include technical user stories as well. They will be working with the customer product owner making sure they’re writing things that work. The person will need to work with both the functional SME’s as well as the technical off shore team to assist in clarifying user stories, align on technical possibilities, do configuration in D365, perform demo/walk throughs of sprint completion. The role would interface daily with the development team that is Off Shore as well as the Technical Architect/Lead who are on PST and CST. Technical guidance will be provided by the Technical lead and Architect.

**From a technical perspective, it’s preferred but not mandatory for the candidate to have the following**:

* Hands on configuration experience with Dynamics
* Data modelling and scripting
* Ability to solve UI problems
* Ability to do screens and mock ups
* Target Mapping
* Reporting
* Ability to use tools such as Azure Dev Ops or Jira… **Azure devops and Jira are both Agile Project Management systems**
* Experience with User Stories

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $85.00 - $95.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Dynamics CRM and Portal Developer
description:
Overview:

GovCIO is currently hiring for a Senior Dynamics Developer to provide development support to a MS Dynamics CRM and Portal implementation. This position will be full remote.
Responsibilities:

Responsible for development support for our Dynamics implementation in an agile environment. This work includes updates to current functionality as well as implementing new functionality. Developing in both CRM and Portal using JavaScript, HTML, FetchXML, .Net and other related technologies.* Designs and codes applications following specifications using the appropriate tools in MS Dynamics with workflows, plugins, and portals.
* Maintains and modifies existing software applications, debugging and resolving issues in code by other developers.
* Knowledge of dataverse and cloud implementations, XRM Toolbox, and other backend tools.
* Participates in code reviews to represent reviewed work for adherence to standards and specifications.


Qualifications:

Bachelor's with 12+ years (or commensurate experience)  

  

Required Skills and Experience* Experience in a fast-paced agile environment
* Technologies: Dynamics365 CRM and customizations, JavaScript, .Net, Power Platform and portals, FetchXML, Dynamics workflows and plugins
* SSO and multi-factor authentication
* Integration between a cloud environment and on prem environments
* Azure pipeline or other CICD experience
* Clearance Required: Must be able to acquire and maintain PBGC Public Trust


Preferred Skills and Experience* Federal or PBGC experience


Company Overview:

GovCIO is a team of transformers-people who are passionate about transforming government IT. Every day, we make a positive impact by delivering innovative IT services and solutions that improve how government agencies operate and serve our citizens.  

  

But we can't do it alone. We need great people to help us do great things - for our customers, our culture, and our ability to attract other great people. We are changing the face of government IT and building a workforce that fuels this mission. Are you ready to be a transformer?  

  

**We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.** All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. EOE, including disability/vets.  

Posted Pay Range  

The posted pay range, if referenced, reflects the range expected for this position at the commencement of employment, however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, education, experience, and internal equity. The total compensation package for this position may also include other compensation elements, to be discussed during the hiring process. If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the GovCIO reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, GovCIO or individual department/team performance, and market factors.
Posted Salary Range: USD $150,000.00 - USD $170,000.00 /Yr.

title: Microsoft Power Platform Developer
description: Role: Cloud services Client: MTA Location: Remote Experience: 10+ years Attached CMP from needs to be signed by candidate and DL copy required JOB SUMMARY: The Microsoft Power Platform Developer will help citizen developers to develop and support applications. The goal is to deliver services and solutions for customers using the suite of Microsoft’s PowerApps/Dynamics platform, custom development, and data integrations on the platform. The consultant will be responsible for all aspects of implementing solutions including development, testing, deployment and process documentation. Ability to develop enterprise business automation solutions using the Dynamics 365 / PowerApps / Power Automate and Power BI - Possesses skill to design responsive web applications compatible to multi device formats. - Ability to develop application with various data services or REST APIs - Possesses basic understanding in one or two programming languages (Eg. Python, C#, Java, JavaScript, NodeJS , PHP etc), tools and/or technology environments, with the ability to learn and apply knowledge quickly. - Demonstrates a broad understanding of the applications and technical architectures related to their area(s) - Ensure the application development team follows governance set coding and design standards, - Ability to accelerate product delivery using the DevOps automation. - Ability to ensure the applications meet the security standards and guidelines. - Strong experience with relational Databases, including SQL Server, and Data modeling - Ability to take client calls and resolves most client issues independently - Ability to create custom plug-in code in .NET framework , C# (Or other applicable programming language) involving CRM SDKs for the Power Apps - Experience in Azure including Azure integration services like Logic apps, Azure Data factory, and Azure Functions CRITICAL SKILLS: Ability to develop and customize model-driven apps. Ability to develop dynamics security roles and configure business units, and teams. Ability to customize dynamics/ power portals. Ability to develop JavaScript and Custom Workflows.

title: Salesforce Developer IV (Top Secret Clearance, US Citizenship required)
description:
To be fully considered for this position, please apply directly on our website at: https://katmaicorp.hua.hrsmart.com/hr/ats/Posting/view/3205

Job Title: Salesforce Developer IV  
Location: US (Primary)  
Job Type: Full-time

Job Description

**SUMMARY**

Supports the U.S. Navy customer’s Enterprise Customer Relationship Management (eCRM) Salesforce applications by migration, integration, iterative development, and sustainment of a cloud-based Software-as-a-Service (SaaS)-infrastructure, maximizing of Out-Of-the-Box (OOTB) features and functionalities for Navy HR adoption.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Manage and customize Salesforce orgs from a technical perspective.
* Effectively create, configure, and deploy VisualForce, Apex, and Lightning Components within a team environment.
* Designs, builds, and implements custom applications on the Salesforce platform utilizing Salesforce declarative capabilities and custom coding capabilities when necessary.
* Build and implement custom applications using the declarative customization capabilities of the Salesforce platform utilizing custom coding capabilities (Apex, Lightning Web Components) to implement technical solutions.
* Design and develop enterprise CRM mid-tier components of web driven n-tier application framework in a Salesforce CRM environment.
* Customize visual layouts, integrate third-party components and systems.
* Work closely with Information Architects, Senior Developers and Product Owners to address user needs, and with Creative Technologists to produce effective and functional solutions while maintaining design integrity across all project phases.
* Work within and across teams to determine, define, develop, and refine customer, business, functional, and technical requirements and participate in application design, configuration, testing, and deployment.
* Produce deliverables such as solution definitions, effort estimations, requirements, test scripts, specifications, and status reports.
* Work closely with Test Team to develop well written and defined test scripts for user stories and perform unit and integration testing of software, troubleshooting and debugging of the system. Produce relevant test documentation.
* Responsible for development of software design and training documentation.
* Build a cross-platform and cross-browser front-end in DevOps environment with continuous integration, regression testing, and deployment.
* Partner closely with UX and back-end engineers to ensure features are developed holistically.
* Implement web services, data persistence access features and external interfaces to third-party systems.
* Follow Agile software development methodology and team architecture and application security standards.
* Participate in design, peer reviews, code, and test inspections throughout life cycle to identify issues/defects.
* Build and maintain trust and respect with clients.
* Maintain regular and punctual attendance.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Mathematics, or Technical Science (e.g., Engineering) and a minimum of six (6) years of experience, more is preferred.
* A minimum of two (2) years actual Salesforce development experience is required, more is preferred.
* Must be able to obtain and maintain a DoD security clearance (U.S. Citizenship required). In some cases, a Top Secret (T5) background investigation must be conducted.
* Background developing/debugging and testing of software applications.
* Salesforce Certification preferred. Proof of Salesforce training required.
* Ability to produce quality technical documentation and analysis.

**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS**

* CompTIA Securty+ certification.
* Experience working as a Salesforce Developer with technical knowledge/experience in languages such as Java, JavaScript, Angular, Bootstrap, AJAX, jQuery.
* Experience with Agile software development and DevSecOps.
* Knowledge and experience with VisualForce, Apex, Lightning Components, and Salesforce APIs.
* Strong understanding of concepts in Computer Science (data structures, run time, common algorithms).
* Working experience with automated testing frameworks (e.g., Eggplant, Selenium).
* Other programming language experience.
* Experience working with Salesforce DevOps including tools and technologies such as Agile Accelerator, Flosum, Copado, Eggplant, and/or Salesforce DX.
* Microservices/API experience (SOAP/REST).
* Self-starter who is comfortable working with various skill sets including other developers and system engineers.
* Upbeat attitude and a passion for learning.
* Organized and efficient with ability to document all stages of the design solutions.
* Experience in Microsoft Office tools (Outlook, Word, Excel, Visio, etc.).
* Troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
* Read, write, and speak fluent English.
* Excellent communication (written and verbal), interpersonal, and soft skills.

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES**

None.

Job Requirements

**WORK SCHEDULE** 

40 hours per week from 8:00 am through 5:00 pm Eastern time. May be required to work additional hours as needed to complete assignment or project.

**TRAVEL**

Potential for travel. When required, employee will need to complete an MVR check.

**DRIVING REQUIREMENTS**

Must have or be able to attain a valid state driver’s license and be insurable on the company’s automobile insurance policy if business travel is required. If traveling for work, employee will need to complete a Motor Vehicle Records (MVR) check. Driving, with or without accommodation, may be required when traveling for training and/or short occasional amounts of local driving. The expected driving time is less than 10%.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**

Work is expected to be remote; however, the company reserves the right to require onsite work.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

Position consists of sitting for long periods of time, bending, stooping, crouching, and lifting weights up to 10 pounds. Frequently uses hands/fingers for manipulation of keyboard and mouse. Seeing up close, must not be color blind. It is Katmai Management Service’s business philosophy and practice to provide reasonable accommodations, according to applicable state and federal laws, to all qualified individuals with physical or mental disabilities.

**COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:** 

* Pay is $130,000 to $160,000 per year.
* Eligible Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life & AD&D Insurance, Voluntary Disability Insurance (STD & LTD), Time Off Benefits (Paid & Unpaid), 401(k) Savings Plan with employer matching, FSA, EAP, and more.

***Compliance:***

*To be considered for this position, all applicants must apply on the company website, https://katmaicorp.com/life-at-katmai/*

*We are a VEVRAA Federal Contractor*

*We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, marital status, familial status or any other characteristic protected by law. https://katmaicorp.com/life-at-katmai/#equal\\_opportunity Preference will be given to Ouzinkie Shareholders, Descendants of Shareholders and Spouses of Shareholders in accordance with Title 43 U.S. Code 1626(g) and Title 42 U.S. Code 2000e - 2(i).*

*Executive Order 11246, as amended, protects applicants and employees from discrimination based on inquiring about, disclosing, or discussing their compensation or the compensation of other applicants or employees.*

Education: Bachelor's Degree  
Category: Information Technology  
Exemption Type: Exempt  
Travel: 0 - 25%

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $160,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Compensation package:

* Yearly pay

Experience level:

* 3 years
* 6 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* For this position, you will be required to obtain and maintain a security clearance. Is this a requirement you will be able to fulfill?

**SUMMARY**

Katmai is looking for an experienced Salesforce Developer to support our U.S. Navy customer’s Enterprise Customer Relationship Management (eCRM) Salesforce applications. This is a very exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge cloud-based technologies.

eCRM supports career management throughout a Sailor’s time in the Navy. eCRM assists in recruiting, Training, and other related Human Resource (HR) related functions. eCRM Salesforce Developers will support migration, integration, iterative development, and sustainment of a cloud-based Software-as-a-Service (SaaS)-infrastructure, maximizing of Out-Of-the-Box (OOTB) features and functionalities for Navy HR adoption.

The Salesforce Developer is responsible for contributing to the development of a Navy system serving thousands of users. The Salesforce Developer manages and customizes Salesforce orgs from a technical perspective. They should be able to effectively create, configure, and deploy VisualForce, Apex, and Lightning Components within a team environment. title: Test Engineer III - eCRM (Secret Clearance, US Citizenship required)
description:
To be fully considered for this position, please apply directly on our website at: https://katmaicorp.hua.hrsmart.com/hr/ats/Posting/view/3177

Job Title: Test Engineer III (eCRM)

Location: ORLANDO, FL 32826 US (Primary)  
Job Type: Full-time

Job Description

**SUMMARY**

Responsible for contributing to development of an enterprise portal serving 1M users using Test methodology, focusing equally on user experience, functionality, and system performance.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

· Define and maintain test system configurations, maintain test data sets, write test plans and procedures ensuring traceability, and perform test executions.

· Communicate with development teams to harmonize the hand-off from development to systems test.

· Write automated test scripts and develop and execute aggressive and accurate schedules for assigned tasks and make adjustments as needed to maintain forward momentum.

· Research and resolve technical issues independently.

· Create test plans/scenarios/procedures that encompass numerous testing activities such as functional, non-functional, nominal, non-nominal, regression, security, performance, etc.

· Utilize enterprise tools for testing activities such as JIRA, LoadRunner, BrowserStack, Selenium, etc.

· Produce reports and documentation for all automated testing efforts, results, activities, data, logging, and tracking.

· Maintain regular and punctual attendance.

· Perform other duties as assigned.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**

· Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret Security Clearance (U.S. Citizenship required).

· Bachelors’ degree (or the equivalent) Computer Science or an equivalent field with a minimum of six (6) years of relevant experience.

· Experience with Salesforce application or other CRM solutions.

· Must complete Salesforce Trailhead training after employment begins.

· Should have five (5) years of experience working in an integrated environment and multi-discipline collaboration (i.e., Systems Engineer, Software Developers, DevOps, etc.).

· Experience leading test teams is a plus.

· Experience developing mobile automated testing solutions.

· Experience with automated unit testing.

· Experience with continuous integration methodologies using tools like Jenkins and Bamboo.

· Experience with best practices in configuration management using tools like SVN.

· Experience with User Acceptance Testing.

· Experience with developing test plans, test cases and test scripts.

· Must obtain and maintain any necessary security access and/or background checks.

**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS**

· Cloud environments such as AWS and Salesforce CRM a plus.

· Must have strong risk management skills and clearly communicate mitigation plans.

· Must have excellent communication experience required to interact with test teams and customers on a daily basis.

· Self-starter who is comfortable working both independently and with various skill sets including other integrators and testers.

· Organized and efficient with ability to document all levels of testing from unit to system testing.

· Experience in Microsoft Office tools (Outlook, Word, Excel, Visio, etc.).

None.

title: Senior Web Developer
description:
Overview:
**TISTA Science and Technology Corporation**, a CMMI Maturity Level 3 company, focuses on delivering information technology and professional services to Federal and State agencies. TISTA is recognized in 2019 by Inc. 5000 as one of the fastest growing private companies in the US. TISTA is also a recipient of 2019 Top Veteran-Owned Companies by the Washington Business Journal. TISTA also received a 2018 Moxie Award in the GovCon category.  

Are you a **Senior Web Developer** who would like to have a positive impact for thousands of people? If so, we may have an opportunity for you!

 **TISTA** associates enjoy above Industry Healthcare Benefits, Remote Working Options, Paid Time Off, Training/Certification opportunities, Healthcare Savings Account & Flexible Savings Account, Paid Life Insurance, Short-term & Long-term Disability, 401K Match, Tuition Reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program, Paid Holidays, Military Leave, and much more!


Responsibilities:
* Responsible for creating and maintaining an engaging web and mobile presence that supports the goals of the customer
* Serves as the liaison to external stakeholders to ensure an up-to-date design as well as day-to-day operations including updating content
* Works pro-actively as part of the creative team to determine user needs and suggest innovative solutions
* Recommends and implements new approaches that enhance the user experience, highlighting the office’s mission and encouraging engagement with the organization's programs
* Optimizes user experience and site content for ranking in search engines  

including HTML, site structure, page layout, and navigation
* Performs ongoing maintenance of website(s)
* Interfaces with external stakeholders regarding website needs and works to develop new features based on customer needs
* Collaborate with IT project teams to ensure
* Performs other related duties as assigned


Qualifications:
* Proficiency in programming languages
* Understanding of search engine optimization (SEO) practices, best practices and responsive design
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and manage time efficiently
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
* Solution-oriented and high-level programming skills
* Ability to troubleshoot and optimize web pages for security and responsiveness
* Understanding of network diagnostics and analytical tools
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced team environment
* Demonstrated creativity, innovation, and good judgment
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and knowledge of Photoshop or other platforms used to create basic graphic content
* Demonstrated intermediate proficiency with WordPress/PHP, HTML, CSS,  

JavaScript, jQuery, Click Dimensions, and CRM Dynamics
* Proven basic proficiency with Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator
* Demonstrated intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills
* Demonstrated knowledge of digital design, user experience, and web accessibility (508) best practices
* Performs other related duties as assigned

 **Education:*** Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related scientific/technical discipline and 4 years’ experience

title: Sr Developer - NetSuite
description:
**Overview:**


We are seeking a talented and experienced Senior NetSuite Developer to join our dynamic team. As a Senior NetSuite Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, customizing, and maintaining NetSuite solutions to meet business requirements. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to implement and enhance NetSuite functionalities, ensuring seamless integration with other systems and applications.  

  

**Responsibilities**:

* Design, develop, and customize NetSuite solutions to address business needs and improve operational efficiency.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, analyze business processes, and translate them into technical solutions.
* Configure NetSuite modules, workflows, scripts, and integrations to optimize system performance and usability.
* Develop SuiteScripts (SuiteScript 1.0 and SuiteScript 2.0) for customizations, automations, and enhancements.
* Implement and maintain integrations between NetSuite and third-party systems using SuiteTalk, RESTlets, and other integration tools.
* Perform data migration, cleansing, and validation activities to ensure data accuracy and integrity within NetSuite.
* Conduct code reviews, performance tuning, and troubleshooting to identify and resolve issues promptly.
* Stay updated on NetSuite releases, features, and best practices to leverage new functionalities and enhance existing solutions.
* Document technical specifications, solution designs, and development activities for reference and knowledge sharing.
* Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers, sharing knowledge and promoting best practices in NetSuite development.

**Qualifications**:

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in NetSuite development, with expertise in SuiteScript, SuiteBuilder, SuiteFlow, and SuiteTalk.
* Proficient in customizing NetSuite workflows, forms, saved searches, and reports to meet business requirements.
* Hands-on experience with SuiteScript development (SuiteScript 1.0 and SuiteScript 2.0), including scripting APIs, debugging, and performance optimization.
* Strong understanding of NetSuite data model, record types, and customization capabilities.
* Experience with NetSuite integrations using RESTlets, SOAP web services, and other integration tools.
* Familiarity with JavaScript, XML, HTML, and CSS for frontend customization and web development.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities effectively.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* NetSuite certification(s) such as SuiteFoundation, SuiteCloud Developer, or Administrator.
* Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies and SDLC practices.
* Knowledge of related technologies such as ERP systems, CRM platforms, and eCommerce solutions.

  
Location


Remote, United States


Salary


$65 - $67 /hour


Job Type


Contract


Date Posted


March 5th, 2024

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
**Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future**


Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech International Corporation, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.


Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer-oriented Salesforce Developer to join our team. This is a remote opportunity.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

* Participate and contribute to sprint planning and sprint review meetings and other Agile Ceremonies.
* Engage directly with stakeholders and end users and provide product demonstrations.
* Implement Salesforce design solutions including system integrations and data analytics.
* Configure software components, units, and modules that meet product specification and development schedules for customers.
* Adhere to product build and release schedules and strategies and use software development pipeline.
* Test and debug complex software components and units.
* Develop product documentation as requested.

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business, Engineering, Math, or related field OR – 10 years of comparable work experience.
* 5+ years of development experience.
* Proficient in Salesforce with Salesforce certification.
* Experience working in an Agile Scrum team and promoting Agile Scrum principles/ practices.
* Experience with ADO, JIRA, or other project management tools.
* Experience in integration with other systems (e.g., Microsoft Office 365, Microsoft Power Platform).
* Experience building data analytics solutions.
* Experience with software development pipelines for deployment (e.g., Azure DevOps).
* Ability to design and build technical solutions using applicable technologies; ability to demonstrate exceptional configuration/coding skills and development discipline.
* Exceptional problem solving, and analytical skills.
* Organized and methodical in development approach.
* Experience working within large cross-functional teams. Must have excellent communications and presentation skills. Ability to work proficiently with MS Office and CRM.
* Proven ability to meet goals and deadlines.
* Exceptional time management and organizational skills.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Salesforce Certification

**Security Clearance Requirements:**

* US citizenship, requiring a background check.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50%.
* Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine and computer printer.
* The person in this position frequently communicates with co-workers, management and customers, which may involve delivering presentations. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.


The projected compensation range for this position is $84,900-$141,100. There are differentiating factors that can impact a final salary/hourly rate, including, but not limited to, Contract Wage Determination, relevant work experience, skills and competencies that align to the specified role, geographic location (For Remote Opportunities), education and certifications as well as Federal Government Contract Labor categories. In addition, ManTech invests in it’s employees beyond just compensation. ManTech’s benefits offerings include, dependent upon position, Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay, Short Term and Long Term Disability, Retirement and Savings, Learning and Development opportunities, wellness programs as well as other optional benefit elections.
For all positions requiring access to technology/software source code that is subject to export control laws, employment with the company is contingent on either verifying U.S.-person status or obtaining any necessary license. The applicant will be required to answer certain questions for export control purposes, and that information will be reviewed by compliance personnel to ensure compliance with federal law. ManTech may choose not to apply for a license for such individuals whose access to export-controlled technology or software source code may require authorization and may decline to proceed with an applicant on that basis alone.


ManTech International Corporation, as well as its subsidiaries proactively fulfills its role as an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, marital status, physical or mental disability, status as a Disabled Veteran, Recently Separated Veteran, Active Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran, Armed Forces Services Medal, or any other characteristic protected by law.


If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a position with ManTech through its online applicant system, please contact ManTech's Corporate EEO Department at (703) 218-6000. ManTech is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer - minorities, females, disabled and protected veterans are urged to apply. ManTech's utilization of any external recruitment or job placement agency is predicated upon its full compliance with our equal opportunity/affirmative action policies. ManTech does not accept resumes from unsolicited recruiting firms. We pay no fees for unsolicited services.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access http://www.mantech.com/careers/Pages/careers.aspx as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation please click careers@mantech.com and provide your name and contact information.

title: Senior Salesforce Developer
description:
Are you motivated to participate in a dynamic, multi-tasking environment? Do you want to join a company that invests in its employees? Are you seeking a position where you can use your skills while continuing to be challenged and learn? Then we encourage you to dive deeper into this opportunity.


We believe in career development and empowering our employees. Not only do we provide career coaches internally, but we offer many training opportunities to expand your knowledge base! We have highly competitive benefits with a variety of HMO and PPO options. We have company 401k match along with an Employee Stock Purchase Program. We have tuition reimbursement, leadership development, and even start employees off with 16 days of paid time off plus holidays. We offer wellness courses and have highly engaged employee resource groups. Come join the Neo team and be part of our amazing World Class Culture!


NeoGenomics is looking for a**Senior Salesforce Developer**who wants to continue to learn in order to allow our company to grow.

**Now that you know what we're looking for in talent, let us tell you why you'd want to work at NeoGenomics:**


As an employer, we promise to provide you with a purpose driven mission in which you have the opportunity to save lives by improving patient care through the exceptional work you perform. Together, we will become the world's leading cancer reference laboratory.

**Position Summary:**


The CRM team within the technology organization is responsible for leading and managing NeoGenomics’s Salesforce.com environment and support. The team operates with a service mentality and its members must have a customer-first approach.


The Salesforce Developer works as part of the CRM technology team dedicated to supporting the Salesforce platform and its users, as well as designing, enhancing, programming, and implementing Salesforce.com development solutions. This role will require working directly with stakeholders, architects, and partners to understand the business needs.

**Core Responsibilities:**

* Customize and configure Salesforce systems.
* Integration and data management.
* Technical design and implementation.
* Testing and documentation.
* User support and training.
* Develop apex, flows, and visualforce.
* Custom User Interface development, including Visualforce pages/Lightning pages, Aura Components and Lightning Web Components (LWC).
* Knowledge and experience differentiating visualforce, aura components, and LWC as well as best-practices to choose the correct solution between them.
* Use Salesforce APIs to integrate with other systems used in the organization.
* Adhere to Salesforce best practices, maintain code documentation, and write/maintain test classes for all custom development.
* Take ownership of release cycles to implement and deploy new/updates to existing applications and code.
* Integrating and maintaining business applications to Salesforce, such as informatica, mulesoft, docusign, marketing cloud, and financial force.
* Collaborating with IT / Developers for other systems in order to integrate across the business.
* Travel: 10%

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, or related field.
* 5+ years of experience as a salesforce developer
* Proficient with Microsoft Visual Studio, Salesforce Lightning Design System and the Salesforce development lifecycle.
* Proven experience with salesforce development and implementing apex, LWC, visualforce, and Java.
* Strong understanding of salesforce best practices and functionality.
* General web development experience with HTML, CSS, Javascript, and other relevant web technologies.
* Strong background in programmatic salesforce development.
* Ability to write, interpret, and critique technical specifications.
* Proficient in sales and service cloud.
* Required Salesforce certifications:
	+ Administrator.
	+ Advanced administrator.
	+ Platform app builder.
	+ Platform developer 1.
	+ Platform developer 2.

title: Techno Functional Consultant - NetSuite
description:

As a NetSuite Techno-Functional Consultant, you will play a key role in implementing and optimizing NetSuite solutions to meet the business needs of our clients. You will leverage your technical expertise and functional knowledge to design, customize, and configure NetSuite modules, workflows, and integrations, ensuring seamless alignment with business processes and requirements.

* Proficient in configuring and customizing NetSuite modules, workflows, forms, and reports to meet business requirements.

* Hands-on experience with SuiteScript development (SuiteScript 1.0 and SuiteScript 2.0), including scripting APIs, debugging, and performance optimization.

* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities effectively.

title: Technical Lead I
description:
The Framework Builder FE team is currently developing a sophisticated platform tool that is aimed at streamlining the management of framework metadata. Our tools are used by hundreds of our developers, with the primary goal of increasing efficiency in our internal development process. Our primary front-end tech stack includes JavaScript, Typescript, React, and Redux. We are looking for a talented front-end focused Tech Lead who is motivated to work on high-visibility projects and has the technical acumen to tackle challenging problems.



As a technical lead on the Framework Builder team at HubSpot, you'll do many things— and you likely already have experience doing some of them in the past. We are looking for people who:


* Have previous software engineering experience in a senior or tech lead position - managing engineers and taking responsibility for the team's software design and delivery, while making individual contributions to the codebase.
* Can identify a problem, build a case for it, and execute independently, leaning into ambiguity
* Foster an environment that encourages autonomy and psychological safety.
* Never accept the status quo; we need engineers and leaders who can see beyond what we have, and towards what we can build while maintaining an understanding about how to get there.
* Demonstrate pragmatic decision-making and problem-solving abilities.
* Work autonomously, lead transparently, and prioritize product and people over strict processes.
* Partner with their triad (Product Manager and Product Designer) to design, scope, and deliver solutions to help our customers manage and grow their businesses.


Tech Leads play to their strengths but are aligned with HubSpot's mission and show the leadership qualities that we've found to be most effective.


*Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we'll let you in on a secret: there's no such thing as the 'perfect' candidate. HubSpot is a place where everyone can grow. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day.*

  


**Cash compensation range:** 173500-225600 USD Annually  

  

This resource will help guide how we recommend thinking about the range you see. Learn more about HubSpot's compensation philosophy from Katie Burke, HubSpot's Chief People Officer.
  

  

The cash compensation above includes base salary, on-target commission for employees in eligible roles, and annual bonus targets under HubSpot's bonus plan for eligible roles. In addition to cash compensation, all HubSpotters are eligible to participate in HubSpot's equity plan to receive restricted stock units (RSUs). Some roles may also be eligible for overtime pay. Individual compensation packages are based on a few different factors unique to each candidate, including their skills, experience, qualifications and other job-related reasons.
  

  

We know that benefits are also an important piece of your total compensation package. To learn more about what's included in total compensation, check out some of the benefits and perks HubSpot offers to help employees grow better.
  

  

At HubSpot, fair compensation practices isn't just about checking off the box for legal compliance. It's about living out our value of transparency with our employees, candidates, and community.  

  

  



*We know the**confidence gap* *and* *imposter syndrome* *can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don't hesitate to apply — we'd love to hear from you.*

  


**If you need accommodations or assistance due to a disability, please reach out to us** **using this form****.** *This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.*

  


***Germany Applicants:*** *(m/f/d) - link to HubSpot's Career Diversity page* *here**.*

  



**About HubSpot**



HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers' needs at any stage of growth. We're also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you'd like to be part of, we'd love to hear from you.



You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #2 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2022, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.



Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit our careers website to learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.



*By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's* *Privacy Notice* *explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot's use of your personal information.*

title: Salesforce Developer/Admin (Remote)
description:
**Salesforce Developer/Admin**

**100% remote**

**Position Type: Full-time**

**Work Hours: 9am to 6pm US EST, Monday to Friday (non-negotiable)**

**About Lot Squared Development:** Lot Squared Development is a leading real estate investment company specializing in the development of high-profile luxury homes and boutique condominiums in Washington, DC. Renowned for our commitment to excellence, we source off-market projects through extensive cold calling, fostering relationships with motivated property sellers. Our projects have gained recognition in reputable publications such as The Washington Post, Urban Turf, Builder Online, and KBB Magazine.

**Position Overview:** We are seeking a skilled Salesforce Developer/Admin to join our dynamic team and play a crucial role in maintaining and enhancing our call center's Salesforce CRM and JustCall CTI dialer systems. This position demands expertise in both Salesforce administration and development, along with a strong understanding of call center operations.

**Responsibilities:**

* Serve as a subject matter expert in Salesforce and operations, providing insights on both high-level business matters and technical aspects.
* Optimize call center performance by analyzing KPIs, uncovering analytics insights, and recommending data-driven solutions.
* Develop business applications for our sales systems, ensuring on-time, high-quality project deliveries.
* Administer call center sales systems (Salesforce and Five9 dialer), ensuring data management, integrity, routine maintenance, and issue troubleshooting.
* Train stakeholders in system usage and develop comprehensive documentation for all aspects of the systems.
* Log developments and report KPIs to stakeholders.

**Technical Requirements:**

* Minimum 7 years of experience with and troubleshooting Salesforce.
* Minimum 3 years of experience designing business applications for Salesforce, with a focus on call center operations.
* Minimum 3 years of experience with predictive dialer software, Five9 experience is a plus.
* Strong knowledge of computer programming languages and concepts.
* Experience in call center, lead management, or sales operations.
* Experience optimizing operations performance, with call center operations being advantageous.
* Relevant certifications preferred: Salesforce Admin Certification or one or more Consulting Cloud Certification (Sales, Service, or Community).

**Soft Skills & Personality:**

* Strong spoken and written communication skills.
* Interpersonal consultative (‘customer service’) skills.
* Diplomacy and facilitation skills.
* Analytical problem-solving.
* Detail-oriented and organized.
* Big-picture business thinker.

**How to Apply:** If you are a highly motivated individual with the required skills and experience, please apply through our Careers Website: https://lotsquared.freshteam.com/jobs/eTNWoAaLk9fw/salesforce-developer-admin-remote

Lot Squared Development is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

*Note: Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.*

title: Product Manager
description:
**Position Title:** Product Manager

**Department:** Information Technology

**Location:** Remote

**Reports To:** Vice President of Information Technology


Installation Made Easy (“IME”) provides software and process management that enable retailers and contractors to offer installed home improvements to homeowners in a convenient, consistent, and affordable manner. IME senior management has over 100 years of retail management and home improvement industry experience.


The Product Manager (PM) is primarily responsible for documenting requirements for system enhancements, new features or bug fixes. The PM will interact with all departments within the company, including Software Development, Business Development, Project Management, Operations as well as with Executive Management. Additionally, the PM will have the potential to interact with Retailer and Manufacturer representatives and third-party vendors.


The candidate must be independently motivated, diligent with details, and precise in their work. Accuracy is a requirement, not an option. Furthermore, the candidate must have the ability to understand a process from beginning to end, ask questions, and think through obscure situations. The candidate must be able to work independently in a remote environment.

**Essential Functions:**

* Work closely with business team to define and document requirements for system enhancements, new features or bug fixes;
* Identify potential unintended impacts of requests and/or additional specifications needed;
* Work closely with development team to create workable tickets by defining Issue, Impact, Steps to Reproduce, Resolution, and Acceptance Criteria;
* Act as liaison between development team and business team to resolve blocked or on-hold tasks;
* Communicate weekly releases;
* Document business/system rules and processes; and
* Perform End User Testing of system enhancements, new features or bug fixes as needed.

 **Minimum Qualifications:**

* 2-4 years of experience as a Product Manager or Business Analyst within software development
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field;
* Experience customizing or building CRM systems
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
* Ability to function well in a high-paced environment.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite with the ability to learn new or updated software.

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience writing software
* Experience as a Software Engineer/Software Developer

 **Physical Requirements:**

* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift 15 pounds at times.

 **Benefits to working with IME:**

* 100% remote work environment
* Employer provided equipment.
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
	+ Health savings plan includes employer contribution to health savings account.
* Medical and dental flexible spending accounts
* Company paid basic life, short-term disability, and long-term disability insurance.
* 401K plan with employer match
	+ Company matches 100% of the first 4% of salary deferrals.
	+ All contributions, including employer contributions, are 100% vested immediately.
* Employee discount program for Electronics, Groceries, Travel, Entertainment, and more
* Employee assistance program
* Pay on demand.
* Critical illness, hospital indemnity, group accident, and legal insurance
* Paid time off.
* And more!

 **We are an Equal Opportunity and Drug-Free Workplace.**


The Job Description is not an exhaustive statement of all duties, responsibilities, or qualifications of the job, nor is it intended to limit opportunities for necessary modifications. The Job Description does not constitute an employment contract of any kind.

title: Test Engineer III - Automation (Secret Clearance, US Citizenship required)
description:
To be fully considered for this position, please apply directly on our website at: https://katmaicorp.hua.hrsmart.com/hr/ats/Posting/view/3174

Job Title: Test Engineer III (Automation)

Location: Remote US (Primary)

Job Type: Full-time

Job Description

**SUMMARY**

Responsible for contributing to development of an enterprise portal serving 1M users using Test methodology should focus equally on user experience, functionality, and system performance.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

· Define and maintain test system configurations, maintain test data sets, write test plans and procedures ensuring traceability, and perform test executions (Automated and Manual).

· Create, execute, and maintain test cases and scripts using Playwright, TypeScript, and CucumberJS.

· Produce reports and detailed documentation for all manual and automated testing efforts, results, activities, data, logging, and tracking.

· Research and resolve technical issues independently, anticipate problems and circumvent them by effectively planning, communicating, and implementing alternative solutions.

· Communicate and work effectively with the Test, Development, and Systems Engineering teams along with the Test Lead to understand project direction including user stories/acceptance criteria, the automation test process and how it functions within the overall SDLC.

· Demonstrate an understanding of the interrelationship of technology and the business application for the customer.

· Effectively multitask across complex assignments and identify obstacles ahead of time.

· Maintain regular and punctual attendance.

· Perform other duties as assigned.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**

· Bachelors’ degree (BS) (or equivalent) in Computer Science or an related field.

· Five (5) years of relevant experience working in an integrated environment and multi-discipline collaboration (e.g., SDET, Test Engineer, Systems Engineer, Software Developers, DevOps, etc.)

· Excellent communication skills required to interact with test lead, other test team members, development team, and customers on a daily basis.

· Self-starter who is comfortable working both independently and with various skill sets including other integrators and testers.

· Detail-oriented, organized, and efficient with ability to document all levels of testing from unit to system testing.

· Must have experience in Microsoft Office tools (Outlook, Word, Excel, Visio, etc.).

· Obtain and maintain a Secret Security Clearance (U.S. Citizenship required).

· Must obtain and maintain any necessary security access and/or background checks.

**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS**

· Experience in test automation using tools such as Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, or similar.

· Familiarity with utilizing open-source software and basic API integration.

· Experience working with Cloud environments such as AWS and Salesforce CRM a plus.

· Experience with continuous integration methodologies using tools like Jenkins, Bamboo, BuildKite, GitLab etc.

· Experience with version control systems such as Git.

· Proficient using IDE tools such as Visual Studio Code and IntelliJ.

· Proficient with programming languages such as JavaScript/TypeScript.

· Experience with issue and project management tools such as JIRA.

· Experience with all levels of testing – unit, functional, system level.

· Experience with developing test plans, test cases, and test scripts that trace to requirements (both manual and automated).

· Experience with best practices in configuration management.

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES**

None.

Job Requirements

**WORK SCHEDULE**

Full-Time 40 Hours per week. May be required to work additional hours as needed to complete assignments or to meet project deadlines.

**TRAVEL**

The expected travel time is less than 25%.

**DRIVING REQUIREMENTS**

Must have or be able to attain a valid state driver’s license and be insurable on the company’s automobile insurance policy. Driving, with or without accommodation, may be required when traveling for training and/or short occasional amounts of local driving. The expected driving time is less than 25%.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**

Work is expected to be remote; however, the company reserves the right to require onsite work.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

Position consists of sitting for long periods of time, bending, stooping, crouching, and lifting weights up to 20 pounds. Frequently uses hands/fingers for manipulation of keyboard and mouse. Seeing up close, must not be color blind. It is Katmai Management Service’s business philosophy and practice to provide reasonable accommodations, according to applicable state and federal laws, to all qualified individuals with physical or mental disabilities.

**COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:** 

* Pay is $95k to $120k per year.
* Eligible Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life & AD&D Insurance, Voluntary Disability Insurance (STD & LTD), Time Off Benefits (Paid & Unpaid), 401(k) Savings Plan with employer matching, FSA, EAP, and more.

Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience)

title: WordPress Technical Support Specialist
description:
As a WordPress Technical Support Specialist, you will be responsible for helping people find success through the use of the Formidable Forms Plugin

  

We are hiring a full-time Technical Support Specialist to join our amazing team. Must be available to work US business hours 9:00 - 5:00 (time zone is flexible).

  

To be successful in this role, you are this type of person:

  

* You are happy, energetic, fun, and passionate about helping others find success
* You are a problem solver and driven to understand and learn new and challenging subjects
* You are self-motivated, self-starting, and accountable for your own success and growth
* You are detail-oriented and able to balance many tasks at once
* You have a desire to learn and grow continually

  

Responsibilities:

  

* Answer technical support questions (Helpscout tickets) about our plugins. Think analytically to come up with logical solutions.
* Troubleshoot and debug issues and create detailed bug reports.
* Add and update documentation pages.
* Monitor and improve our processes and user experience. How can we reduce overall support and serve our customers better?
* Assist with QA testing
* Continue learning and building on your programming languages in order to provide the best customer support in the tech industry and contribute to our plugins.
* Bring new ideas to the team in order to help our business continue to grow.

  



Requirements to be considered for this position:

  

* Working knowledge of WordPress, WordPress Plugins, and WordPress themes. - experience building or supporting these is a huge plus.
* Solid HTML and CSS knowledge. Demonstrate an understanding of code principles
* Troubleshooting and debugging skills - know how to use your browser developer tools to diagnose and debug a problem (javascript error, CSS conflict, etc.).
* Great English writing skills. You'll be writing and communicating with clients and other team members primarily in writing. Clear and effective communication is key.
* Self-driven work ethic. You need to be a self-starter who loves taking initiative and seeing things through to completion. We have a small team so each member has a lot of responsibility and a lot of involvement in the direction our company takes.
* Curiosity and the desire to learn. Creative ideas and involvement with our clients fuel the growth of our company. We also need team members who are able to efficiently find answers to their questions.
* A dependable work environment. Since you'll be working from home, you'll need a reasonably fast computer and a reliable high-speed internet connection.
* Ability to work during our business hours (US PST or MST 9-5)

  



Bonus points if you have the following:

  

* Proven track record providing support for WordPress plugins.
* Working knowledge of JavaScript and PHP
* Experience working with common email marketing service providers and CRM tools.
* Experience with WordPress development (eg themes, hooks, filters, plugin API, etc).

  



What you get when you work with us:

  

Strategy11 is a fast-growing company run by Steve and Steph Wells, we love to work hard and have fun. We love our team of amazing people from all over the world. Here’s what we offer.

  

* Competitive Salary.
* Work from your home or anywhere in the World. We currently have employees in the US, Canada, Romania, Ireland, Philippines, Nigeria, and many more countries.
* Unlimited PTO after 90 days of employment. We encourage employees to take the time they need for vacation, to stay healthy, and to spend time with friends and family.
* Health insurance benefits for US employees.
* We reimburse for software you’ll need as well as books or courses that promote continued learning.
* We give you the opportunity to solve challenging and meaningful problems that make a difference.
* Opportunity to work with a diverse and fun group of people.

  



Inclusion Statement:



Strategy11 (Formidable Forms, Business Directory Plugin), we strive to have the broadest possible view of diversity, going beyond visible differences to include the background, experiences, skills, and perspectives that make each person unique. Strategy11 is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, Veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Contact Center Junior Developer
description:
**Description**


Leidos is seeking a **Contact Center Junior Developer** with strong experience with managing queues, skills, users, and administrative changes in the Call Center CXone application.


Our Leidos Customer Service team supports the US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD), Office of Single-Family Housing in their *Mission to create strong, sustainable, inclusive communities and quality affordable homes for all.*


This is an opportunity to build on technical skills while working closely with the Call Center IT Project Manager, Test Manager, and various IT resources. The opportunity is in support of the digital modernization of HUD’s FHA Resource Center and support of the HUDCentral program.

**Job duties include:**

* Responsible for professionally interacting with internal customers to probe for and understand agency mission needs.
* Responsible for managing users, skills, and reports in the NICE inContact CXone application to support operational needs.
* Responsible for backing up lead IT telephony engineer by completing IVR changes in both regular releases and emergency change requests.
* Responsible for meeting with internal program managers and customers to analyze and understand program requirements, customer goals, and future needs.
* Responsible for managing contact center modernization projects, working in conjunction with other IT and management staff.
* Responsible for proactively suggesting and delivering continuous improvements by analyzing existing business operations and identifying technical solutions that will improve efficiency, performance, and the user experience.
* Responsible for improving contact center efficiency and customer service.
* Responsible for completing detailed meeting minutes for technical change meetings.
* Responsible for completing and documenting testing for both CXone changes and Salesforce CRM changes.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Required Skills:**

* Bachelor's degree
* Minimum of 2+ years of experience providing contact center operations management support for federal agencies and/or government contractors.
* Ability to successfully obtain a Public Trust Security clearance, which includes a credit check and background investigation
* Ability to write and maintain detailed documentation of technical system processes.
* Strong knowledge/experience with NICE inContact CXone.
* Experience with Customer Relationship Manager (CRM) user testing.
* Knowledge of and ability to apply Agile/Scrum development methodologies to contact center IT modernization projects.
* Ability to work east coast hours (9:00 am ET - 5:00 pm ET)

**Strong knowledge of contact center technologies and solutions such as:**

* ACD
* IVR
* CTI
* CRM
* Reporting
* Performance Management

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Workforce Management Experience including NICE WFM forecasting.
* Contact Center Project Management experience.
* Experience with Agile product development rhythms.

**Come join our rapidly growing team and enjoy these benefits:**

* Access to benefits on day one including medical and dental insurance, 401K, Life, AD&D, and Voluntary Disability plans.
* Paid Time Off (PTO) accrued based on Leidos policy, up to 3 weeks your first year.
* Ten paid holidays per year.
* Ongoing training to promote your success.
* Tuition reimbursement is based on Leidos' policy.
* Discounted Leidos stock purchase and other Employee Discounts.


Leidos is a global leader providing solutions to make the world safer, healthier, and more efficient through technology, engineering, and science. Our company believes in engaging, developing, and empowering our diverse and valued people to foster a culture of creativity and growth.


HUDFHA

**Original Posting Date:**
--------------------------


2024-03-01
While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.

**Pay Range:**
--------------


Pay Range $65,000.00 - $117,500.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.
