title: IT Project Coordinator
description:
#### **Optimize the Global Technology Team's operations**



The Good Food Institute (GFI) is a nonprofit think tank working to make the global food system better for the planet, people, and animals. Alongside scientists, businesses, and policymakers, GFI's teams focus on making plant-based, fermentation-enabled, and cultivated meat delicious, affordable, and accessible. Powered by philanthropy, GFI is an international network of organizations advancing alternative proteins as an essential solution needed to meet the world's climate, global health, food security, and biodiversity goals.


#### **How You Will Make a Difference**



In this role, you will have the opportunity to ensure efficient and effective service delivery by coordinating key IT projects and initiatives, including data governance, data analytics, and web development, and serving as the liaison between the IT team and their internal clients. **The IT Project Coordinator** will be responsible for:


* Serving as a project coordinator for the team; developing and maintaining project documentation, including project charter, resource plan(s), timeline(s), and other project documents as needed, and shepherding projects through to delivery.
* Maintaining the project portfolio in Asana and Google Workspace, creating tasks and schedules, identifying resource needs, and providing regular progress updates to relevant stakeholders.
* Creating technical and training documentation in collaboration with product leads and leading efforts to create a knowledge base.
* Supporting the Senior Director of Technology and the broader Technology team to build out and strengthen service delivery best practices, including supporting yearly and cycle planning processes.
* Assisting with employee onboarding and device lifecycle management, including device procurement, deployment, retirement, and disposal.
* Liaising with other GFI U.S. and GFI affiliate team members to gather requirements, monitor project progress, evaluate resource needs, and identify and address risks.
* Performing other duties as assigned.

#### **Who We're Looking For**



The **IT Project Coordinator** must have:


* A minimum of three years of applicable work experience, preferably in a project coordination or operations-focused role; demonstrated experience with Asana or a similar project management platform is required.
* Familiarity with project management methodologies, and prior experience coordinating technical projects and creating project documentation strongly preferred.
* The ability to work well independently, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines.
* Exceptional organization skills and attention to detail.
* Knowledge of software supporting key GFI operations: WordPress, Salesforce CRM, Marketing Cloud Account Engagement are a plus; prior experience with Google Workspace is required.
* Proven ability to collaborate effectively while communicating with project stakeholders to assign accountability; experience working with technical leads and software engineers is a plus.
* A commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion and to building an inclusive workplace where everyone feels like they belong.
* Comfort working remotely and in a rapidly growing and evolving organization.
* Strong support for GFI's philosophy and mission; demonstrated interest in plant-based & other alt proteins, public health, environmentalism, climate change, animal protection, or hunger relief.
* A commitment to GFI's values: believe change is possible, do the most good we can, share knowledge freely, act on evidence, and invite everyone to the table.


We want the best people and we don't want biases holding us back. We use a third-party anonymizing tool to redact personal information from submitted applications — including name, location, contact details, and several other factors — to reduce bias and increase fairness in our process. We strongly encourage people of every race, color, orientation, age, gender, origin, and ability to apply. Since we value a diverse workplace, we prioritize an inclusive climate absent of discrimination and harassment during the application process and after you join the team.



Research indicates that men tend to apply for jobs when they meet just 60% of the criteria, while women and people from other marginalized groups only apply if they are a 100% match. If you are passionate about GFI's mission and think you have what it takes to be successful in this role even if you don't check all the boxes, please apply. We'd appreciate the opportunity to consider your application.


#### **The Fine Print**


* **Terms of employment:** Full-time, exempt
* **Reports to:** Marco Pelloni, Lead Web Developer
* **Location:** Remote; United States
* **Travel:** Up to two weeks per year for organization retreats (reasonable accommodations for and exemptions from organization retreats considered on a case-by-case basis).
* **Benefits:** Working from home, full medical coverage, optional dental and vision packages, a 401(k) plan with employer match, flexible holiday and vacation plans, lifestyle spending account, opportunity for advancement, respectful managers, and supportive colleagues. More information here: https://tinyurl.com/GFIBenefits.
* **This is a U.S.-based position:** In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.
* **COVID vaccination policy:** GFI requires all US employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Proof of vaccination will be requested before the start of employment. GFI will consider requests for accommodations or exemptions from this policy on a case-by-case basis, in accordance with applicable laws. More information here: https://tinyurl.com/GFICovidPolicy.
* **Salary:** $69,002.70 - $72,452.90 (depending on experience and qualifications)

#### **Important Dates**


* **Application deadline:** March 28, 2024
* **Anticipated start date:** On or around May 1, 2024

**Decided not to apply?** If after reviewing this job description, you have decided not to apply, please let us know why by completing this short survey: https://tinyurl.com/GFIJobSurvey.


**Interested in working at the Good Food Institute?** Join us for the Career Opportunities Webinar to learn more about our work and ask questions about specific job opportunities! See upcoming webinar dates and more information at https://tinyurl.com/GFICareers.



  

#### **Application Instructions**



GFI uses an anonymized hiring system that redacts key identifying personal information from all applications. We are testing this tool as part of an effort to reduce bias in our hiring process. Following these instructions will help to ensure your application is not delayed by a failed redaction.


* **Where possible, limit the creative formatting of your documents.** If the name on your resume is an inserted image file or is styled with large spaces between each letter, for example, the redaction is likely to fail. Colors and designs are OK, but wherever possible, the text itself should just be regular text.
* **Please use consistent names.** It helps to ensure that the name you use in your resume and cover letter is the same as the name you type into the application below. For example, if your name is Jennifer, please sign your cover letter as "Jennifer" rather than "Jenny."
* **Submit PDF or .docx files only.** Other file formats, like .txt, are likely to fail redaction.
* **Please do not include personal identifying information in your responses to the application questions.** Referencing past education, work experience, and mission-alignment is OK.
* **Please do not contact the role's supervisor or any potential member of the hiring team.** If you have questions, please email careers@gfi.org.

  

  

Thank you for helping us to ensure that the redaction process works smoothly and to review your application as quickly as possible!

title: Zoho CRM Engineer
description:
### **Job Information**


Industry


Technology
Remote Job


### **Job Description**


This is a remote position.


**Overview:** We are seeking an experienced Zoho CRM Developer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in customizing and implementing Zoho CRM solutions. As a Zoho CRM Developer, you will play a key role in designing, coding, testing, and implementing solutions to meet our organization's unique needs. This position requires a deep understanding of Zoho CRM functionalities, integration capabilities, and a proven track record of successful project implementations.  

  

  

### **Requirements**

**Responsibilities:**

  

* **Customization and Configuration:**

  

	+ Customize Zoho CRM modules to align with business processes.
	+ Configure and optimize workflows, validation rules, and assignment rules.
* **Integration:**

  

	+ Integrate Zoho CRM with third-party applications, APIs, and other business systems.
	+ Develop and maintain data synchronization processes between Zoho CRM and other platforms.
* **Automation:**

  

	+ Design and implement automation workflows to streamline business processes.
	+ Develop and maintain scripts using Deluge scripting language for advanced customization.
* **Reports and Dashboards:**

  

	+ Create and customize reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights.
	+ Implement and optimize data analytics within Zoho CRM.
* **Training and Support:**

  

	+ Provide training sessions for end-users and internal teams on Zoho CRM functionalities.
	+ Offer ongoing support to resolve issues, troubleshoot errors, and optimize system performance.
* **Security and Access Control:**

  

	+ Implement and manage security protocols to safeguard data integrity.
	+ Configure role-based access controls to ensure proper data access levels.
* **Documentation:**

  

	+ Document customizations, configurations, and processes for future reference.
	+ Keep documentation up-to-date with changes and enhancements.
**Requirements:**

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.


* Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience with Zoho CRM development.


* Proficient in Deluge scripting language.


* Strong understanding of CRM best practices and industry standards.


* Experience in integrating Zoho CRM with other applications and systems.


* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


* Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

  

* Zoho CRM Developer Certification.


* Experience with other Zoho applications (Zoho Creator, Zoho Analytics, etc.).


* Knowledge of web development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).


* Familiarity with agile development methodologies.

  

If you are a motivated Zoho CRM Developer with a proven track record of successful implementations and a passion for optimizing business processes, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us and be a key contributor to our ongoing success!

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
Ziff Davis Shopping helps millions of shoppers discover and save, delivering exceptional consumer and merchant-advertiser experiences across a portfolio of leading mobile and ecommerce brands. Our domestic brands include RetailMeNot, Offers.com, Blackfriday.com, TechBargains and more. We also run the leading Cash Back, Reward and Coupon codes brands in the UK (Voucher Codes).  

**About The Role:**  

We are seeking an experienced and driven Product Manager to join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in the development and enhancement of our internal platforms, including Content Management Systems (CMS), Admin Systems, and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tools. This is an internal-facing role where many of your users are your co-workers. You will work with a team of smart fullstack developers to build the tools that are the backbone of the business and enable teams to accomplish their work.  

The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, excellent project management skills, and a deep understanding of software development processes. This role offers the opportunity to shape and lead the evolution of critical systems that power our organization's digital presence and customer engagement strategies. **What You’ll Do:*** Product Strategy and Vision:
	+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and executive leadership to define and communicate a clear product vision, strategy, and roadmap for the CMS, Admin Systems, and CRM tools.
	+ Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and user feedback to identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.
	+ Relentlessly reduce operational and system complexity.
	+ Drive the organization to strategically smart decisions related to our internal systems
* Requirements Gathering and Documentation:
	+ Work closely with internal teams and external partners to elicit, prioritize, and document detailed product requirements, user stories, and use cases.
	+ Translate business needs into technical specifications and provide clear and comprehensive documentation for development teams.
* Project Management:
	+ Develop and maintain project plans, timelines, and milestones for the development of CMS, Admin Systems, and CRM tools.
	+ Drive the agile development process, including sprint planning, backlog grooming, and release management.
	+ Monitor project progress, identify risks, and proactively implement mitigation strategies to ensure timely and successful delivery.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration:
	+ Collaborate with engineering, design, quality assurance, and other teams to ensure seamless coordination and alignment throughout the product development lifecycle.
	+ Foster a culture of open communication and knowledge sharing among team members.
* User Experience and Design:
	+ Advocate for exceptional user experiences by working closely with design teams to ensure intuitive and user-friendly interfaces for CMS, Admin Systems, and CRM tools.
	+ Develop intuitive, efficient, and scalable CMS UI & workflows, with a commitment to continual process improvement
* Product Launch and Adoption:
	+ Plan and execute product launches, including communication, training, and support materials to ensure successful adoption by internal users and customers.
	+ Monitor post-launch performance metrics and gather feedback for continuous improvement.
* Technical Acumen:
	+ Possess a deep understanding of technical concepts, architecture, and development processes to effectively communicate with engineering teams and make informed decisions.
	+ Dedication to quality, and accuracy, with 100% accountability and willingness to become the subject matter expert on your products and tools.

**Qualifications:*** Minimum of 4 years of experience in technical product management, with a proven track record of delivering successful software products.
* Strong knowledge of CMS, admin systems, and CRM tools, including industry best practices and emerging trends.
* Proficiency in agile methodologies and project management tools.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills.
* Ability to analyze complex technical and business challenges and drive innovative solutions.
* Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with diverse stakeholders.
* Prior experience in software development or a technical role is a plus.

  

**We Offer Great Benefits:*** Company-sponsored medical, dental, and vision insurance (including domestic partner coverage) + pet insurance
* Flexible Vacation / Paid Time Off
* Charitable Giving Programs that include Paid Time off to volunteer and donation match
* Family Planning Programs like MAVEN Fertility Concierge
* Pregnancy and Paid Parental Leave (up to 16 weeks)
* 401K savings plan with employer match
* Employee stock purchase program (ESPP)
* Wellness Programs: Gym reimbursement, Lose It! and Calm subscriptions
* Hybrid, Remote and Flexible work arrangements
* Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can collaborate with teams across the company while making an impact in the areas that most excite you!

  

U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Information
Individuals seeking employment at Ziff Davis are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation. You are being given the opportunity to provide the following information in order to help us align with federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action record keeping, reporting, and other legal requirements.
Ziff Davis Shopping is a business unit within TSE. A division of Ziff Davis, Inc.

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
**Kibernum**, es una de las empresas **líderes** en tecnología presente en **Chile**, **Perú**, **Colombia** y **USA**.Llevamos más de 30 años en el mercado entregando servicios de calidad y gran valor agregado a nuestros clientes, por lo que nos encontramos muy bien posicionados.


En KIBERNUM nos mueve instalar capacidades flexibles, a través del mejor **talentotech** del mundo, para impulsar la **evolución digital**. Actualmente contamos con una dotación que supera los 1500 colaboradores, cuyas áreas de expertise se destacan entre otras: tech, Staffing, IT Academy y Agile Delivery.



### **Funciones del cargo**


* Liderar la configuración y optimización del Salesforce CRM para la captura efectiva de información de clientes y transacciones desde el sitio de comercio electrónico del cliente.
* Gestionar la conectividad entre el CRM del cliente y la instancia K12 B2C de SF y Service Cloud, abarcando servicios al cliente B2C, servicios al cliente B2B y soporte.
* Implementar integraciones clave con plataformas externas, incluyendo Shopify, Reviews.io, Campaign Monitor, Snowflake y AI Tutor (posiblemente).
* Liderar la migración de datos, la automatización en Salesforce y la creación de dashboards/informes, posiblemente utilizando plataformas como PowerBI o Tableau.
### **Requerimientos del cargo**


* Título en Ingeniería de Sistemas u disciplina similar.
* Nivel avanzado de inglés (C1).
* Experiencia práctica en la configuración de Salesforce CRM, incluyendo la gestión de leads, oportunidades, cuentas y trayectoria de incorporación.
* Conocimientos sólidos en la conexión del CRM del cliente a la instancia K12 B2C de SF y Service Cloud, abarcando servicios al cliente B2C, servicios al cliente B2B y soporte.
* Experiencia en integraciones clave con plataformas como Shopify, Reviews.io, Campaign Monitor, Snowflake y AI Tutor (posiblemente).
* Experiencia en migración de datos, automatización en Salesforce y creación de dashboards/informes, posiblemente utilizando plataformas como PowerBI o Tableau.
### **Condiciones**



100% remoto - Full Time  

Proyecto a corto plazo (6 meses)



**Fully remote** You can work from anywhere in the world.
**Flexible hours** Flexible schedule and freedom for attending family needs or personal errands.
**Remote work policy**
----------------------



**Fully remote**


Candidates can reside anywhere in the world.

title: Business Solutions Manager- SFDC
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a skilled Business Solutions Manager to join our Global Sales Enablement product management team. In this role, you will be responsible for setting a vision and developing comprehensive Business Requirement Documents (BRDs) for our Licensing and subscription selling efforts and serving as the primary liaison between the business and technical teams. Your expertise in understanding and documenting business needs, willingness to develop a clear vision combined with your ability to communicate these to technical teams, will be crucial in driving the successful


development and implementation of these internal products.

  

This Global role will play a critical role in managing internal products related to our Salesforce.com environment and, as such, the successful candidate needs to have demonstrated experience in SFDC, an understanding of CRM current and future state and the ability to help design outcomes in the SFDC environment. This should include familiarity with the underlying structure, experience as an admin within the SFDC environment and a willingness to learn and expand capabilities within SFDC.

  

US Base Pay Range USD $104,000 - 166,000


MX Base Pay Range MXN 750,000- 1,100,000  

We will be accepting applications until a final candidate is identified.  

  

The above reflects the pay range that QSC reasonably expects to pay for this role. This pay range also depends on various factors such as job duties and requirements, relevant experience and skills and geographic location. In addition to the base salary range, QSC offers a comprehensive package including but not limited to health benefits, 401K or Roth retirement plans, generous time off and profit sharing.  

  

QSC thrives where innovative technology and compelling audio-visual experiences intersect. For over 50 years, QSC has pioneered the technology and solutions that enable immersive cinema, live performance audio, themed entertainment, digital collaboration and meeting experiences for our customers and partners around the world. A globally recognized innovator in the design, engineering, and manufacture of category leading high-performance loudspeakers, digital mixers, power amplifiers, audio processors, digital cinema solutions, and the Q-SYS™ software-based audio, video and control Ecosystem.  

  

By joining the QSC team, you will be in a challenging, collaborative, fun, and innovative environment. We encourage employees to take ownership, to color outside the lines, and to imagine possibilities. Our culture is casual but dynamic, with cross-functional teams collaborating on creating memorable audio-visual experiences that deliver joy to people, wherever they are. At QSC, fun and hard work go hand in hand. Join us and make a difference in the way people experience movies, meetings, presentations, live performances, and much more.  

  

Q-SYS is a cloud-manageable audio, video and control (AV&C) Platform built around a modern, standards-based IT architecture. With established solutions across Corporate, Education, Hospitality, Venues & Events, Cinema, Government, Healthcare, and Transportation, Q-SYS redefines what is possible for live and virtual experiences by uniting hardware and software partners, developers, and creators.  

  

QSC Pro Audio delivers high-performance loudspeakers, digital mixers, power amplifiers, software and accessories. Our innovative products and solutions, supported with free training & education and unparalleled customer service, set the stage for creators, performers, and entertainment providers to confidently deliver impactful experiences for their audiences.


Responsibilities:
* Be able to fully understand and articulate the business conditions, rationale and scope for your supported product(s) Collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to gather and analyze business needs and requirements.
* Develop and maintain detailed Business Requirement Documents (BRDs) that clearly articulate the business needs and requirements.
* Build and set vision for SFDC products and work cross-functionally to successfully build capability to meet current and future needs of the business
* Serve as the primary point of contact for the business side, ensuring that the technical team fully understands the project's business aspects.
* Work closely with the technical team to translate business requirements into functional specifications.
* Participate in product development meetings, offering insights from a business perspective and ensuring that product developments align with business objectives and customer needs.
* Facilitate communication between business stakeholders and the technical team throughout the project lifecycle.
* Conduct regular reviews of ongoing projects to ensure that they remain aligned with the BRDs and business objectives.
* Manage changes to the BRDs and communicate impacts to both business and technical teams.
* Assist in the prioritization of product features and enhancements based on business needs and market trends.
* Monitor and report on the progress of product development against business goals and objectives.
* Provide cross-support as needed to other Product Managers


Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent relevant experience
* Proven experience in creating detailed Business Requirement Documents.
* Strong understanding of business processes and the ability to translate business needs into technical requirements.
* Experience in product management or a related field is desirable.
* Minimum 5-years of experience of SFDC Advanced Admin experience (7-10 preferred)
* SFDC – full understanding of the platform capabilities, AppExchange and APIs

title: Salesforce Solution Architect, Service Cloud
description:
### **About NeuraFlash:**



We are a leading AI and Consulting Partner of Amazon & Salesforce obsessed with helping our customers transform their contact centers with AI Powered Experiences. Our expertise spans across the Amazon ecosystem with Amazon Connect, Lex & Contact Lens and Salesforce ecosystem with Service Cloud Voice, Einstein Bots and Digital Channels, Service Cloud, Field Service, CPQ, MuleSoft, and Einstein Analytics. We are experts in building experiences grounded in data that transform and optimize the employee and customer journey.


### **What sets NeuraFlash apart?**



At NeuraFlash, our people form the core of our business and the soul of our brand. We hire individuals who inspire us and look at challenges as opportunities to create innovative solutions. You'll be provided with ongoing education and development opportunities via our Salesforce Partnership Program and mentorship programs created for our aspiring leaders. NeuraFlash is on the forefront of cutting-edge technologies and we understand by investing in you, we're investing in ourselves!


We are adding a **Salesforce Solution Architect** to our incredible Service Cloud practice! Working closely with and reporting to our Service Cloud Practice Lead, you will be responsible for bringing Salesforce project implementations to life by working with our customers to understand their business, identify their requirements, and design, develop, QA and launch their solutions. We are building a best-in-class delivery team and this role will have the opportunity to make significant contributions to our success by working with the rest of our talented team, exciting customers, and partnering closely with our Artificial Intelligence Team!


### **You will have the opportunity to:**


* Facilitate business process reviews to identify customer requirements and processes
* Translate customer requirements into Salesforce design, leveraging best practices and minimizing the need for custom development
* Configure Salesforce Service Cloud solutions
* Develop technical requirements and specifications for customers and the technical delivery team
* Drive best practice UX design into each and every aspect of solution delivery
* Manage all aspects of projects and customer communications
* Deliver customer end user training and documentation
* Oversee and be accountable for the successful completion of all aspects of assigned projects
* Exercise independent judgment, and take the lead role on enterprise level projects with minimal direction from senior management
* Lead vision and strategy discussions with contact center and customer service leadership and management
* Partner with our Artificial Intelligence team to create innovative Salesforce solutions for our customers

### **Required Qualifications:**


* 3+ years project experience in a hands on technical consulting and project management role
* 2+ years of project delivery experience with Salesforce
* Deep understanding of Salesforce administration required (Service Cloud and Sales Cloud)
* Expert in designing and creating Service Cloud solutions using Salesforce declarative configuration
* Experience with Experience Cloud and CRM Analytics highly preferred
* Demonstrated ability to document requirements for technical resources, and ability to fully understand technical solutions leveraging Apex, VisualForce and Web Services
* Experience leading multiple Salesforce Project deployments including release and multi-environment management, integration to legacy systems using Salesforce APIs, and requiring original code development
* Professional experience owning the end-to-end Software/Systems Development Lifecycle (SDLC) including structured code management, project management expertise and process methodology
* Experience leading Enterprise Service Cloud projects - including ground-up Service and Sales Cloud deployments
* Proven ability to successfully juggle multiple projects, deliverables and deadlines simultaneously

### **Preferred Skills:**


* Ability to understand and assess how business processes can be improved using Salesforce
* Great with customers, quickly builds credibility, and a fantastic team player!
* **Certifications:** One or more current Salesforce certifications (Admin/Advanced Admin, Sales/Service Cloud/CPQ/Field Service, Platform Developer 1 or 2, App Builder), multiple certifications preferred
* BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or similar technical degree or equivalent experience

### **What's it like to be a part of NeuraFlash?**


* Remote & In-Person: Whether you work out of our HQ in Massachusetts, one of our regional hubs, our India office, or you're one of over half of our NeuraFlash Family who work remotely, we're focused on keeping everyone connected and unified as one team.
* Travel: Get ready to pack your bags and hit the road! For certain roles, travel is an exciting part of the job, with an anticipated travel commitment of up to 25%. So, if you have a passion for adventure and don't mind a little jet-setting, this opportunity could be your ticket to exploring new places while making a positive impact on clients.
* Flexibility: Do you have to take the dog to the vet, pick up the kids from school, or the in-laws from the airport? We know that a perfect 9-5 isn't possible. So you have to jump out to do any of those, no problem! We build a culture of trust and understanding. We value good work not the hours in which you get it done
* Collaboration: You have a voice here! If you work with a team of smart people like we do, it's a no-brainer to take suggestions and feedback on how to keep NeuraFlash thriving. Our executive team holds town halls & company meetings where they address any suggestions or questions asked, no matter how big or small.
* Celebrate Often: We take our work seriously, but we don't take ourselves too seriously. Whether it is an arm wrestling contest, costume party, or ugly holiday sweaters our teams love to have fun. And while we work hard, we don't forget to slow down and celebrate the big things and the small things together.

### **The "Flashy" Perks:**


* Be in the right space: Work at the forefront of AI & Innovation on the Salesforce and AWS Platforms.
* Growth: In 2023, we grew our team by 21%, and we plan to do the same again this year! There's no limit to where your career at NeuraFlash can go.
* L&D Program: We are invested in your success. This program was built to help our employees advance in their career in Salesforce and at NeuraFlash.
* The Buddy Program: Each new team member is assigned a mentor to help them acclimate at NeuraFlash.
* Monthly & Weekly Socials: We hold monthly & weekly virtual socials to have more opportunities to be together.


*Location: NeuraFlash strives to provide you with the flexibility to work in the location that makes the most sense for your lifestyle. For those that prefer an office setting, this role may be based in any of our hub locations within the United States, and India. If you prefer to work from your home, we can accommodate remote locations anywhere in the United States for our U.S. based employees, anywhere within British Columbia and Ontario for our Canadian employees, and anywhere within Colombia for our Colombian based employees!*

title: LEAD CRM DEVELOPER/ARCHITECT
PLADS Salesforce Einstein Analytics Developer
description:
**Salary Range:** $55,000 - $140,000

 **We’ve Got You Under Our Wing**


We are the duck. We develop and empower our people, cultivate relationships, give back to our community, and celebrate every success along the way. We do it all…*The Aflac Way*.

  

Aflac, a Fortune 500 company, is an industry leader in voluntary insurance products that pay cash directly to policyholders and one of America's best-known brands. Aflac has been recognized as Fortune’s 50 Best Workplaces for Diversity and as one of World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere.com.

  



Our business is about being there for people in need. So, ask yourself, are you the duck? If so, there’s a home, and a flourishing career for you at Aflac.

 **Work Designation.** This role is **remote.** This means you will be expected to work from your home, within the continental US. There may be occasions that you are requested to come to the office based on business need. Any requests to come to the office would be communicated with you in advance.

 **What does it take to be successful at Aflac?**

* Acting with Integrity
* Communicating Effectively
* Pursuing Self-Development
* Serving Customers
* Supporting Change
* Supporting Organizational Goals
* Working with Diverse Populations

 **What does it take to be successful in this role?**

* Working knowledge of:
	+ Einstein Analytics (AKA CRM-Analytics) Administration/Architecture
	+ Data Models and database structure
	+ Writing queries using SOQL and SOSL
	+ Business Intelligence Management
* Understanding of the development release cycle on the Salesforce Platform
* Attention to detail and results oriented, with a strong customer focus
* Ability to work as part of a team and independently
* Problem-solving skills to gather and present results in a manner applicable to a diverse stakeholder group
* Communication skills to collaborate, explain and answer data related questions
* Technical writing skills for documenting design of complex solutions
* Ability to prioritize workload to meet tight deadlines
* Knowledge of continuous integration/development tools (preferred)
* Ability to work in environments with competing and alternating priorities, with a constant focus on delivery
* Ability to refine business acumen and establish domain / industry vertical expertise

 **Education & Experience Required**

* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information systems or related field
* Five or more years of experience developing and maintaining dashboards within Einstein Analytics (Tableau CRM/CRM-Analytics) and/or working with queries
* Experience in all phases of software development including design, configuration, testing, debugging, implementation, and support of large-scale, business centric and process based applications

*Or an equivalent combination of education and experience*

 **Education & Experience Preferred**

* Salesforce Admin Certification
* Einstein Analytics and Discovery Consultant Certification
* Life, Absence & Disability insurance industry experience

 **Principal Duties & Responsibilities**

* Translates simple to moderately complex user stories into functional and actionable software within the Salesforce environment – following Salesforce best practices
* Contributes to the development effort by participating in workshops, speaking about technical solutions, building prototypes and taking on coding assignments
* Collaborates on and informs cross-functional teams of new feature technical designs, technical requirements, limitations, and implementations
* Responsible for unit testing, integration testing, and performance testing of new product functionality; analyzes and mitigates issues identified during testing
* Actively participates in meetings with representatives from multiple business and/or IT units
* Performs other related duties as required

 **Total Rewards**

*This compensation range is specific to the job level and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to: education, experience, licensure, certifications, geographic location, and internal equity. The range has been created in good faith based on information known to Aflac at the time of the posting. Compensation decisions are dependent on the circumstances of each case. This salary range does not include any potential incentive pay or benefits, however, such information will be provided separately when appropriate. The salary range for this position is $55,000 - $140,000.*

 *In addition to the base salary, we offer an array of benefits to meet your needs including medical, dental, and vision coverage, prescription drug coverage, health care flexible spending, dependent care flexible spending, Aflac supplemental policies (Accident, Cancer, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity offered at no costs to employee), 401(k) plans, annual bonuses, and an opportunity to purchase company stock. On an annual basis, you’ll also be offered 11 paid holidays, up to 20 days PTO to be used for any reason, and, if eligible, state mandated sick leave (Washington employees accrue 1 hour sick leave for every 40 hours worked) and other leaves of absence, if eligible, when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Aflac complies with all applicable leave laws, including, but not limited to sick and safe leave, and adoption and parental leave, in all states and localities.*

title: Dynamics Engineer
description:
Description:

MICROSOFT DYNAMICS DEVELOPER (CRM/CE)


WayPath’s technical team consists of Front End, Back End and Full Stack Developers all charged with solving client challenges with software. Whether we’re creating customer-facing products or developing tools that connect your internal team, our software expertise has the power to change the way you do business.


As a Senior Dynamics Developer at WayPath, your job might seem straightforward. Write some code, test it, debug it, and start again. While that's part of it, that's just the beginning, our Developers are also consultants. They partner with client stakeholders, agile project teams, and end users to understand desired features and functionality so that they can develop the highest-quality technical solution.


Requirements:
**Desired Skills & Experience** *While we believe that skills can be developed over time, we need our Software Developers to have most of these skills on day one:*

* 5+ years of Experience working with agile software development teams to build, implement, and customize Microsoft Dynamics CRM software.
* Solid understanding of object-oriented programming, design patterns, application frameworks, and database design.
* Experience producing well-documented and efficient code while also explaining complex technical information to client stakeholders and development teams.
* Passion for emerging technology trends with a desire to stay current; encouraging teams to learn and adopt new technologies.
* Strong communication skills; enthusiastic about engaging in discussions with clients, and project team members, about technical best practices.
* Experience creating workflows, custom plug-ins, and integrations
* Ability to manage and mentor junior talent and contractors
* Knowledge in building custom .NET (C#) enterprise web applications.

*WayPath provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics.* We are a Great Place to Work® Certified company!

title: Tribal Project Developer (Remote)
description:
**Tribal Project Developer (HQ Tribal, Denver, Remote)**  

  

**Why you want to work here...**  

GRID Alternatives is a national leader in making clean, affordable solar power and solar jobs accessible to low-income communities and communities of color. GRID is an entrepreneurial, high-growth non-profit organization that provides direct solar installation and project development; clean mobility options; workforce training and service learning opportunities; and low-income solar policy advocacy.  

  

**Our Vision: a rapid, equitable transition to a world powered by renewable energy that benefits everyone.**  

**Our Mission: to build community-powered solutions to advance economic and environmental justice through renewable energy.**  

  

Based in Oakland, California, GRID has 8 regional offices and affiliates serving all of California, Colorado, Washington D.C., Virginia, Maryland, and Delaware; GRID also works in Nicaragua, Mexico and Nepal. GRID has a dedicated staff of 380 and growing!
  

  

**What it's like at GRID…**  

At GRID, we care about each other and know that each employee has a whole self that includes life outside of work. Our culture supports learning, growth and well-being of all of our team members. Every member of GRID Alternatives must participate in the organization's equity, inclusion, and diversity (EID) work.  

  

GRID Alternatives provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetics. Because we value EID at GRID Alternatives, we encourage folks from all backgrounds to apply, even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications.  

  

**About the Tribal Program**  

Since 2010, GRID Alternatives’ has worked with tribal communities across the United States to support their renewable energy goals and visions for a sustainable future through tribal focused programs. The Tribal Program supports tribes in asserting control over their energy resources and focuses on making project implementation feasible by leveraging state and federal programs, philanthropic dollars, and partnerships with other tribes across Indian County while working in alignment to identify, develop, finance and implement solar power projects that meet community needs, including education, hands-on training, and energy cost reductions for tribal members.  

  

Since 2018, the Tribal Solar Accelerator Fund (TSAF) , a tribal-led grantmaking program, has partnered with 85+ tribes and 50+ tribal individuals to support renewable energy development, workforce and training, and leadership development goals. The TSAF has provided tribes with access to philanthropic capital through competitive grantmaking and leadership development programs. At its core, TSAF is about more than just regranting; it’s about mobilizing and developing tribal solar projects and integrating workforce development and training, nation-building, and strengthening the energy resilience of tribal communities with visions for a clean energy outlook for generations to come. The upfront expenses to install and maintain solar systems are out of reach for many tribal communities, which is why TSAF funding has been critical to each grantee we have supported.  

Together, we are doing three key things to create a tribal renewable energy community that enhances and strengthens energy resilience and energy sovereignty by:
* Increase access to funding for Tribal communities to achieve their renewable energy goals.
* Support tribal leaders and youth in renewable energy to transform their communities
* Support Tribal partners building capacity to address their community’s energy needs and achieve their renewable energy visions.


**The Opportunity…**  

The GRID Alternatives National Tribal Program’s headquarters is located in Denver, CO, but seeking a Tribal Project Developer to work from Denver or remotely. This role will ensure that all project components and partners come together so residential, community, and commercial solar systems are built on time and on budget, and deliver on our mission to make the benefits and opportunities of renewable energy accessible to tribal communities. The position will report directly to the Tribal Deputy Director and work with the Co-Executive Director of Implementation and Co-Executive Director of Development and the Tribal Solar Accelerator Fund (TSAF).  

Project Development
* The Project Developer will be responsible for developing, guiding, and analyzing the project process throughout the life cycle to assure project goals and objectives are maintained and budget targets are achieved.
* Originate new project opportunities through close collaboration with the Executives, Directors, Managers, and staff
* Research historical data to come up with accurate pricing forecasts. Coordinates with the Project Management team to communicate client requests. Establishes and updates budgets for project development and maintains information in Salesforce CRM database.
* Negotiate final site agreements with Tribes and project hosts/partners to ensure long term project and partnership success
* Maintain complicated schedules, develop project timelines, and manage people and materials to complete jobs on schedule and within budget
* Lead the land development process: complete critical risk assessments, secure development permits, procure and manage subcontractors to complete any needed Environmental Site Assessments, Civil work/engineering, geotechnical reports, Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plans, title work, easement and other site development work/reports needed to move projects forward
* Guide the negotiation of final utility interconnection and producer agreements, and work with Commercial Engineer to complete interconnection studies
* Ensure that major equipment is purchased in accordance with contracts, and on time and within budget parameters by working closely with Tribal construction staff, as well as the project design engineers and procurement staff
* Develop and secure community solar offtakers/subscription agreements through direct outreach and relationship building, as well as collaboration with Tribal Team, Headquarters, regional staff, and leveraging GRID’s software tools

Construction Program
* Work with the National Tribal Program staff, Policy and Development, Philanthropy, and Regional Offices to develop a strategy for project development implementation for expanding solar and storage access in Tribal Communities.
* Manage construction budget and timeline by working closely with the Co-Executive Director of Implementation, Deputy Director, Project Managers, and Construction Managers
* Serve as primary point of contact between financing partners and on-site construction staff and project stakeholders
* Conduct site visits and utilize site visit information to design and validate components including array layout, electrical gear, conduit locations, structural/electrical engineering requirements, interconnection requirements, and equipment specifications.
* Establish internal processes and secure external subcontractors to ensure that each project has an asset management, operations and maintenance, outreach, insurance, and financial management plan to ensure projects are able to close on financing and generate long-term impacts
* Manage a diverse team of external project team members with competing priorities, such as utilities, investment partners/co development partners, affordable housing providers, non-profit and community-based partners, government agencies, third party land/rooftop owners, and subcontractors such as civil engineers
* Manage a cross-functional team of internal project team members such as regional directors/project development staff, engineering and design, procurement specialists, outreach and project managers
* May have to supervise staff, interns, solar corp members for fundraising, grants, and other areas for project development


**What you need to bring to this role...**
* Minimum of five years in development, electrical construction, and project management experience, with a focus on multi unit residential, community, and commercial PV installations
* Thorough understanding of PV system design, NEC code, OSHA standards, and installation best practices
* NABCEP Certification preferred
* Demonstrated success in managing complex multiyear projects with both internal and external stakeholders
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills
* Detail-oriented self-starter who is internally motivated and also excels in a team environment
* Flexible and willing to embrace change, go the extra mile, and bring ideas and energy to rapidly growing organization
* Leadership qualities such as creativity, capacity to motivate others, understanding teams and their needs, eagerness to accept responsibility, and intelligent and action oriented judgment
* Proficient with MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Project, Google applications like Gmail and GoogleDocs, ASANA, and CRM databases like Salesforce. Ability to quickly learn new programs including: HelioScope, PVSyst, Energy Toolbase, and PVWatts Calculator
* Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills. Ability to write clearly, concisely, and professionally


  

**Where you will sit & the places you may go...**  

This position may rarely require up to 25% out-of-town travel to regional offices and special projects such as company-wide celebrations, team building exercises, etc. Availability to work nights and weekends may very rarely be required.  

  

GRID Alternatives may provide vehicles for work travel and/or travel reimbursement for personal vehicle use. In this instance, applicants must hold a valid driver’s license and have a good driving record.
**Let's Talk Money**  

This is a full-time, non-exempt position. Hourly pay commensurate with experience within the pay band ($70k-$99k annually), plus the benefits below.  

  

**How we take care of you...**  

Medical, Dental, Vision/Eye Care insurance, 5 weeks paid time off (PTO),13 paid holidays, Commuter Checks, 403b Retirement Plan, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Health Savings Account (HSA), STD, LTD, and AD&D insurance  

  

**Ready to Apply?**  

Submit a resume describing your interest. Due to the high volume of inquiries, mailed and emailed applications are not accepted. Please do not call and/or email requesting an update.  

  

**Thank you for your interest in GRID Alternatives!**

title: Senior Business Analyst, Process & Infrastructure
description:
About GitHub: As the global home for all developers, GitHub is the complete AI-powered developer platform to build, scale, and deliver secure software. Over 100 million people, including developers from 90 of the Fortune 100 companies, use GitHub to build amazing things together across 330+ million repositories. With all the collaborative features of GitHub, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write faster, better code.  

Locations: In this role you can work from Remote, United States  

Overview:

GitHub helps companies and organizations succeed by allowing them to build better software, together. We are looking for an experienced Senior Business Analyst for our Revenue Process and Infrastructure team.

  

In this role, you will help us grow and scale our processes by serving as a key subject matter expert for our revenue tech stack. You will work closely with stakeholders in Revenue, Marketing, Customer Success, Operations, and Business Systems to streamline our processes as it relates to our CRM and tech stack.

  

GitHub is an exciting place to work and you'll be an important contributor and join a tight-knit environment of technical and business-minded individuals.


Responsibilities:
* Develop and define processes across our sales cycle (end to end), including process flows and visualizations.
* Conduct analysis to identify areas for process optimization and work with Sales Enablement to implement.
* Understand and define the data to be shared across the company to create powerful insights that drive real impact.
* Understand the relationship between the data and how it may impact existing business rules and processes.
* Collaborate with key cross departmental stakeholders to gather business requirements and identify potential impacts to the Sales organization as well as other key upstream and downstream impacts.
* Collaborate with cross departmental teams to effectively drive projects to success: sales entry / exit criteria, process risk mitigation, documentation and enablement, timelines, etc.
* Working in partnership with our IT departments to enable the creation and management of users of the platform, roles, permissions and entitlements.
* Working in partnership with our IT departments to manage release upgrades and hot fixes with respective testing needed to ensure functionality is working as expected.
* Working in partnership with our IT departments and across the Organization on designing and implementing integrations between our CRM tooling and other applications and the data warehouse.
* Oversee the management and use of the necessary technical tools and platforms.
* Working collaboratively with our software vendors to develop product modifications and improvements as and when required.
* Provide coaching, mentoring, and leadership to fellow team members.


Qualifications:
**Required Qualifications:**

* Minimum 7 years of experience in business consulting, sales, sales operations, business analysis, business administration, business operations, or a related field
* Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience driving process changes with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tools like Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics, Totango or others
* Demonstrable ability in managing key stakeholders with skills in taking core feature requests and translating them into business requirements and use cases.
* Experience supporting revenue teams with building process and enhancing technology across the full end-to-end customer lifecycle

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Passionate about team collaboration and delivering outstanding customer service alongside an ability to partner with stakeholders to identify key business objectives
* Expertise in Salesforce configure, price, quote (CPQ)
* Project management training and/or experience preferred
* Demonstrates problem solving, decision-making, process-improvement, strong organizational and analytical skills
* Proven experience in creating end-to-end business process documentation for customer facing team consumption and internal operations
* Proven experience handling conflicting priorities and ability to prioritize based on business needs


Compensation Range: USD $89,200.00 - USD $236,600.00 /Yr.  

  

In addition, certain roles also have the opportunity to earn sales incentives based on revenue or utilization, depending on the terms of the plan and the employee's role.  

  

These pay ranges are intended to cover roles based across the United States. An individual's base pay depends on various factors including geographical location and review of experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant. At GitHub certain roles are eligible for benefits and additional rewards, including annual bonus and stock. These rewards are allocated based on individual impact in role. In addition, certain roles also have the opportunity to earn sales incentives based on revenue or utilization, depending on the terms of the plan and the employee's role.  

GitHub Leadership Principles:
**GitHub values**


* Customer-obsessed
* Ship to learn
* Growth mindset
* Own the outcome
* Better together
* Diverse and inclusive


**Manager fundamentals**


* Model
* Coach
* Care


**Leadership principles**


* Create clarity
* Generate energy
* Deliver success


Who We Are: GitHub is the world’s leading AI-powered developer platform with 100 million developers and counting. We’re also home to the biggest open-source community on earth (and 99% of the world’s software has open-source code in its DNA). Many of the apps and programs you use every day are built on GitHub.  

Our teams are dreamers, doers, and pioneers, leading the way in AI, driving humanitarian efforts around the globe, and even sending open source to Mars (and beyond!). At GitHub, our goal is to create the space you need to do your best work. We’re remote-first and offer competitive pay, generous learning and growth opportunities, and excellent benefits to support you, wherever you are—because we know that people flourish when they can work on their own terms.  

Join us, and let’s change the world, together.  

EEO Statement: GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. title: CRM Systems Developer
description:
**Concentric Corporation is currently seeking a talented** **CRM Systems Developer** **for our client for a remote position!**


**The position of** **CRM Systems Developer** **holds pivotal importance in the enhancement and development of our client’s Salesforce platform. As a central component of our integrated CRM, ticketing, omni-channel marketing, and web systems, this role focuses on customizing Salesforce to accommodate diverse business functions and workflows, including integrations with other platforms. Collaborating closely with the CRM Systems Administrator, the CRM Product Manager, web developers, and various stakeholders, the CRM Systems Developer designs and implements solutions aligned with the Museum’s digital transformation objectives and fosters a comprehensive view of constituents.**


**Key Responsibilities**


* **Lead the technical aspects of Salesforce platform development, configuration, and customization to meet Museum’s business requirements, employing expertise in Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Web Components, and Process Builder to deliver innovative solutions enhancing business processes and user experiences.**
* **Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, design solutions, and develop custom code and configurations, ensuring alignment with technology strategy and architecture goals under the guidance of the Digital Platforms and Solutions Architect.**
* **Provide technical guidance, support, and training to the CRM Systems Administrator, including end-user support and coordination with Salesforce and other vendors to address issues and seek assistance when necessary.**
* **Develop and maintain integrations between Salesforce and other systems to streamline processes and enhance data quality, working closely with the IT data team to ensure data integrity and security.**
* **Ensure the performance, security, and scalability of the Salesforce platform by monitoring system performance, optimizing operations, and implementing best practices for security and scalability in coordination with the CRM Systems Administrator.**
* **Stay updated on new Salesforce releases, features, and functionality, making recommendations for leveraging them to improve Museum’s business processes. Facilitate smooth roll-out of releases to the production environment through testing, evaluation, and collaboration with stakeholders.**
* **Develop and maintain technical documentation, including design documents, technical specifications, and user guides, to ensure comprehensive understanding and continuity in system management and usage.**


**Qualifications**


* **Education: Bachelors of Science or Arts degree**
* **Experience: 3 or more years of Salesforce development experience**
* **Demonstrated experience in Salesforce development, with a strong understanding of Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Web Components, and Process Builder.**
* **Demonstrated experience with Salesforce integrations, including SOAP and REST APIs, and experience with third-party integration tools such as MuleSoft or Dell Boomi.**
* **Experience with version control systems such as Git and deployment tools such as Salesforce DX.**
* **Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to design and implement complex solutions.**
* **Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with technical** **and non-technical stakeholders.**
* **Knowledge of the Salesforce non-profit service pack (NPSP).**
* **Experience providing training, especially of technical information to a non-technical audience.**
* **Demonstrated interpersonal skills and the ability to build and maintain positive relationships with colleagues.**
* **Demonstrated ability to write unambiguous prose related to technical and data concepts, policies, procedures, and guidelines.**
* **Ability to collaborate and help lead processes that span across departmental areas.**
* **Ability to adjust and adapt to changing circumstances and shifting priorities.**

  


**If you are looking to advance your career as a** **CRM Systems Developer****, look no further! Please apply below to learn more about this incredible opportunity. Only the most qualified applicants will be contacted for interviews.**

  


**REF# 2501**

  


**Concentric Corporation brought back the fundamentals of recruiting, which starts with the relationship.** **We upgraded the approach in executive search by being deliberate & purposeful. Our audience’s instincts & goals are our first & only priority. We uncover true motives in hiring & career advancement by having transparent and honest conversations. This is how we “connect excellence!” Once we determine the tangible skillset, culture fit, and urgency of both sides, we become the bridge between professionals and their future career.**

  

**Follow Concentric Corporation on** **LinkedIn****,** **Facebook****,** **Instagram** **&** **Twitter****!**

title: Integrations Solutions Developer - Remote
description:
At the American Cancer Society, we're leading the fight for a world without cancer. Our employees and 1.5 million volunteers are raising the bar every single day. We actively seek candidates from diverse backgrounds including communities of color, the LGBTQ community, veterans, and people with disabilities. The greater the diversity of our people, the better we can serve our communities.  

  

The people who work at the American Cancer Society focus their diverse talents on our lifesaving mission. It is a calling. And the people who answer it are fulfilled.


The role of the Integration Solution Developer is to enable source and destination systems to communicate & transfer data between each other. The Integration Solution Developer contributes in the design, build/development, configuration, test, and optimization of integrations and APIs for cloud and on-prem, off-the-shelf, SaaS, and custom written applications. This includes implementation of changes into production, application monitoring, being the highest escalated tier for troubleshooting, and data clean-up. Acts as a subject matter expert to internal IT groups and provides feedback and recommendations to management relative to the optimization of integrations between environments and automation of repeatable tasks.**\\*\\*\\*This is a remote position that can be home based anywhere in the United States. Developer Certification in Boomi is required.\\*\\*\\***

**MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES**


Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

* Design, build/configure, test, and deploy integrations and APIs between applications
* Plays a role in the creation of new technical test, staging, and production environments and establishes appropriate standards and strategies for these environments.
* Works with the development, QA, and release team to ensure that any new releases take place with minimal impact to the business
* Ensures adequate backup and disaster recovery provisions exist
* Provides developer level (Tier 3) support to support teams as needed
* Documents technical systems, processes, and procedures clearly and completely
* Collaborate and contribute on highly complex projects across different teams
* Contribute in estimating Level of Effort, scoping, and tracking work via Azure DevOps
* Performs regular data security reviews
* Performs application and system Disaster Recovery planning and exercises for Business Continuity.
* Automates standard procedures where possible
* Participating in an on-call rotation and war-room situation as necessary.

**KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS**

*FORMAL KNOWLEDGE:*

* Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or Computer Science with a minimum of 6 years of relevant developer integration experience and recognized as a subject matter expert.
* Developer Boomi certification required to demonstrate formal knowledge and understanding of concepts to be put into practice.
* At least one enterprise Boomi implementation on development side. Cannot only be production support.
* Minimum 5 years Boomi developer experience designing, building, and orchestration of administration playbooks experience required.
* Minimum of 4 years building and/or maintaining integrations with Salesforce or a CRM system required.
* Subject Matter Expert level for Boomi application in-order to make developer and architecture design recommendations against functional/user requirements.
* Knowledge of Salesforce, NetSuite, Concur, and/or Coupa a plus.
* Minimum 5 years supporting integrations and APIs between websites, financial applications, customer facing applications, and internal-based enterprise applications required
* Demonstrated understanding of integration and API technical architecture principles, including REST, SOAP, JSON, XML, HTTP methods such as GET & POST are required.
* Knowledge of end-to-end testing principle and practice
* Experience supporting Salesforce preferred.
* Knowledge of the SDLC process, including the testing of integrations
* Experience working in a DevOps environment
* Experience establishing and tuning environments
* Experience with git source control required
* Proven experience managing multiple tasks/issues simultaneously.
* Demonstrated scripting skills in one or more common languages is required (Java, C#, Node.js, XML technologies, Javascript/JSON).

*COMPETENCIES/SKILLS:*


Demonstrates Information Technology Competencies:

* Business insight - Applies knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization’s goals.
* Decision quality - Makes good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.
* Action oriented - Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.
* Optimizes work processes - Knows the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement.
* Ensures accountability - Holds self and others accountable to meet commitments and deadlines.
* Collaborates - Builds partnerships and works collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
* Communicates effectively - Develops and delivers multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.
* Instills trust - Gains the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity.

  

Other Skills:

* Demonstrated ability to analyze complex data and communicate complex technical analysis to technical and non-technical audiences
* Strong technical skills with the ability to coordinate, manage, and ensure the success of product deployments
* Excellent problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills

*SPECIALIZES TRAINING OR KNOWLEDGE:*

* Developer certification in Boomi required.
* Solution Architect Boomi certification a plus
* Understanding of API Gateway
* Knowledge of Java and/or Javascript programming language
* Integration between Salesforce and ERP system, preferably NetSuite

*SPECIAL MENTAL OR PHYSICAL DEMANDS:*

* Self-Starter with ability to organize work for others
* Excellent relationship-building and client-partnering skills
* Strong interpersonal, written/verbal communication skills
* Ability to work well under pressure and work on multiple tasks simultaneously
* Must be available to work flexible hours
* Periodic on-call availability is required.
* Handle being a Subject Matter Expert for design, build, test, and support of integrations


The starting rate is $88000 to $110000 annual. The final candidate's relevant experience/skills will be considered before an offer is extended. Actual starting pay will vary based on non-discriminatory factors including, but not limited to, geographic location, experience, skills, specialty, and education.


The American Cancer Society has adopted a vaccination policy that requires all staff, regardless of position or work location, to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (except where prohibited by state law).


ACS provides staff a generous paid time off policy; medical, dental, retirement benefits, wellness programs, and professional development programs to enhance staff skills. Further details on our benefits can be found on our careers site at: jobs.cancer.org/benefits. We are a proud equal opportunity employer.

 **Position Requirements:**

title: Product Manager, Student Relationship Technology (Remote)
description:
The Product Manager, Student Relationship Technologies, is a key player at UAGC, tasked with managing and evolving Salesforce products and other student-facing technologies. This role demands executing strategic initiatives, enhancing student experiences, and ensuring seamless, user-friendly interactions with our platforms. The ideal candidate combines technical proficiency, strategic insight, and a first-principles thinking approach to problem-solving, ensuring innovative and effective solutions.


**Duties & Responsibilities:**


* Product Strategy Execution: Implement the strategic product roadmap for Salesforce-based solutions, aligning with UAGC's mission and goals.
* Collaborative Development: Engage with stakeholders to translate needs into product enhancements and innovations.
* Backlog Management: Efficiently manage the product backlog, prioritizing high-impact features.
* Technical Collaboration: Partner with technical teams to ensure the delivery of superior Salesforce solutions.
* Quality Assurance Support: Contribute to the QA process to surpass user expectations.
* Performance Analysis: Utilize product performance analytics for continuous improvement.
* Salesforce Advocacy: Keep abreast of Salesforce developments to maximize platform potential.
* Trend Monitoring: Stay informed on industry trends to maintain and enhance the competitive edge of UAGC’s Salesforce solutions.
* User Experience Focus: Lead UX design efforts, ensuring intuitive and engaging interfaces.
* Data Management and Governance: Oversee data integrity and compliance within Salesforce, establishing robust governance practices.
* Customization and Personalization: Develop strategies for tailored Salesforce experiences.
* Integration Leadership: Spearhead integration projects with other institutional systems for seamless user experiences.
* Training and Support: Design and implement training and support structures for Salesforce platform users.
* Change Management: Manage and communicate changes effectively, facilitating smooth transitions for users and stakeholders.


**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**


* Solid understanding of Salesforce, including customization, configuration, and integration.
* Experience with agile development methodologies and tools.
* Strong project management skills, with a track record of delivering projects on time and within budget.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the skill to turn complex needs into actionable technical solutions.
* Familiarity with change management processes and integration project leadership.
* Strong communication and training skills, capable of leading cross-functional teams.


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree or equivalent advanced learning attained through professional level experience required.
* Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience, or equivalent combination of education and work experience.


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Proven experience in the B2C or higher education sectors.
* Experience with UX/UI design principles and data governance.
* Salesforce certification (e.g., Salesforce Administrator, Salesforce Developer) is highly desirable.
* Minimum of 5 years of product management experience, specifically with Salesforce or similar CRM platforms.


*Outstanding UA benefits include health, dental, and vision insurance plans; life insurance and disability programs; paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays; UA/ASU/NAU tuition reduction for the employee and qualified family members; retirement plans; access to UA recreation and cultural activities; and more!*


The University of Arizona has been recognized for our innovative work-life programs.


**Rate of Pay:** $86,870 - $112,932


**Compensation Type:** Salary at 1.0 full-time equivalence (FTE)


**Grade:** 11


**Compensation Guidance:**


The **Rate of Pay Field** represents the University of Arizona’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting. The University considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role and associated responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, education/training, key skills, and internal equity.


The **Grade Range Minimum, Midpoint, and Maximum Fields** listed below represent a full range of career compensation growth over time in this position and grade. Each unit typically sets starting pay between minimum and midpoint upon hire. The university offers compensation growth opportunities within its career architecture. To learn more about compensation, please review our Applicant Compensation Guide (https://talent.arizona.edu/sites/default/files/Applicant\\_Guide\\_to\\_Compensation.pdf) and our Total Rewards Calculator (https://hr.arizona.edu/employees-affiliates/compensation/total-rewards-calculator) .

**Grade Range Maximum** : $138,993
