**Job Family:** Applications Development


**Job Function:** Information Technology


For more information regarding this position, please contact us at careers@uagc.edu .


UAGC shall, in all solicitations or advertisements for all employees placed by or on behalf of UAGC, state that all applicants who are qualified will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, pregnancy, marital status, registered domestic partnership status, age, physical disability, mental disability, genetic information, gender identity, military or veteran status, service in the uniformed services, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws.


Where higher education meets technology – that’s The University of Arizona Global Campus. At UAGC, students discover relevant degree programs, innovative technology, and cherished tradition. UAGC offers associate, bachelor’s, and master’s online degree programs. The mission of UAGC is to provide high-quality, accessible, lower cost, and innovative, educational programs that meet the diverse needs of individuals pursuing advancement in their lives, professions, and communities. For more information, please visit www.uagc.edu , Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/UniversityOfArizonaGlobalCampus/) , Instagram (https://https://www.instagram.com/uazglobalcampus/) , LinkedIn (https://https://www.linkedin.com/company/university-of-arizona-global-campus/) or Twitter (https://www.twitter.com/UAZGlobalCampus) .

title: Sr .Net Developer
description:
Contraqer is the leading provider of procurement management software in the Federal market. VARs, Systems Integrators, and Manufacturers use our SaaS to manage opportunities; research awards; source pricing; generate compliant quotes; and manage fulfillment. Contraqer integrates with many CRM and ERP products to enable clients to push and pull data however they need. With Contraqer, our clients minimize low-value manual work so that they can increase their quote rates and win rates.

**Position**

We are looking for a top-notch Senior .NET Developer (SDD) to join our team. This is a key role, leading our development efforts and working directly with our CEO to advance our products. The SDD will also lead the migration of our application from Azure Commercial to Azure GCC High.

This role is flexible and 100% remote with the expectation to be in the Washington, DC area 3 or 4 times a year. **Candidates MUST be US citizens to be considered**.

**Responsibilities**

¨ Design solutions collaboratively and work with the team to write the code to bring them to life

¨ Manage and refactor existing code to extend current functionality

¨ Optimize code and our Azure infrastructure

¨ Explore new technologies that we can use to make our products even better

**Prerequisites**

¨ Must be authorized to work in the US

¨ Bachelor’s degree

¨ Minimum of seven (7) years of relevant work experience

¨ Proficiency in C#, SQL, TypeScript/JavaScript (AngularJS), Entity Framework, and Elastic

¨ Strong in Object Oriented Programming, MVC, Design patterns, and SOLID principles

¨ Extensive experience with Microsoft Azure in general, both Commercial & GCC High, and Azure DevOps in particular

¨ Experience with Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI Service, and Copilot

¨ Experience with Web services development (SOAP, REST)

¨ Familiarity with Agile development methodologies

¨ Good communication skills – written and verbal

¨ Intellectually curious

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $140,000.00 - $180,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching

Experience level:

* 7 years

Work Location: Remote

title: Salesforce CRM Analytics Developer
description:
**Job Description: Salesforce CRM Analytics Developer**  

  

The CRM Analytics Developer is responsible for leading the design and development of analytics on the Salesforce CRM Analytics platform. The role will be responsible for designing and building analytics, reports, dashboards by engaging the business and the Salesforce CRM team. The role requires an advanced understanding of CRM (Einstein) Analytics, analytics concepts, and the Salesforce platform to design impactful and supportable solutions that meet the business objectives.  

  

Where required by law, NTT DATA provides a reasonable range of compensation for specific roles. The starting pay range for this remote role is $78-$97.78. This range reflects the minimum and maximum target compensation for the position across all US locations. Actual compensation will depend on a number of factors, including the candidate's actual work location, relevant experience, technical skills, and other qualifications. This position may also be eligible for incentive compensation based on individual and/or company performance.  

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Partner with business stakeholders to understand and document their business processes, data, and reporting needs. Analyze and document data definitions, sources, limitations, and priorities.
* Design impactful, attractive, compelling solutions using Salesforce CRM Analytics.
* Architect data and transformation processes including dataflows and datasets, as well as create dashboards.
* Understand the impact of existing system architecture, dataflows, and network constraints and design solutions optimized.
* Develop the dataflows, dashboards, and associated assets utilizing CRM Analytics, the Salesforce platform, and related technologies.
* Partner with application developers and system owners to extract and load data relevant for the solution.
* Serve as solution consultant required to perform hands-on delivery of CRM Analytics reports and dashboards.
* Perform QA and deployments following best practices.


**Skill and Experience Requirements**
* 5+ years' development experience with CRM Analytics
* Experience with analyzing and visualizing large volumes and multi-tenant data using CRM Analytics.
* Experience with crafting and managing dataflows/recipes and setting up CRM Analytics apps, datasets, Sharing, and Security predicates.
* Experience with building/maintaining dashboards and working with bindings, connecting data sources from other Salesforce and non-Salesforce Systems.
* Knowledgeable in standard functions/ modules of Salesforce: Sales and Service Objects and their relationships in Salesforce.
* Strong knowledge of Salesforce design principles, technically scalable data modeling and data access security controls.
* Experience in designing, building, and support/troubleshooting of CRM Analytics Dashboards, Lenses, Datasets, Dataflows including the implementation of enterprise level security.
* Advanced experience in Salesforce Analytics Query Language (SAQL) and deep understanding of JSON.


**Nice to have skills and experience**
* Working knowledge of Salesforce CRM architecture and security model.
* Solid understanding of Einstein Discovery, trend, comparison, and predictive modelling.
* Salesforce certification or Einstein Analytics Accreditation.

  

About NTT DATA Services:  

  

NTT DATA Services is a recognized leader in IT and business services, including cloud, data and applications, headquartered in Texas. As part of NTT DATA, a $30 billion trusted global innovator with a combined global reach of over 80 countries, we help clients transform through business and technology consulting, industry and digital solutions, applications development and management, managed edge-to-cloud infrastructure services, BPO, systems integration and global data centers. We are committed to our clients' long-term success. Visit nttdata.com or LinkedIn to learn more.  

  

NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regarding to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter so that we may connect you with the appropriate team.

title: Network Engineer and System Administrator
description:

title: Marketing Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Pax8 is the leading cloud-based technology marketplace, simplifying the cloud journey for our partners by integrating technology, business intelligence and proactive service to deliver an unparalleled experience. Serving thousands of partners through the indirect sales channel, our mission is to be the world's favorite place to buy cloud products. We are a fast-growing, dynamic and high-energy startup organization, allowing you to make a meaningful impact on the business. Culture is important to us, and at Pax8, it's business, and it **IS** personal. We are passionate, creative and humorously offbeat. We work hard, keep it fun, and expect the best.

We Elev8 each other. We Advoc8 for our partners. We Innov8 continuously. We Celebr8 life.

No matter who you are, Pax8 is a place you can call home. We know there's no such thing as a *"perfect"* candidate, so we don't look for the right "*fit*" – instead, we look for the add. We encourage you to apply for a role at Pax8 even if you don't meet 100% of the bullet points. We believe in cultivating an environment with a diversity of perspectives, in hopes that we can all thrive in an inclusive environment.



We are only as great as our people. And we have great people all over the world. No matter where you live and work, you're a part of the Pax8 team. This means embracing hybrid- and remote-work whenever possible.

**Position Summary:**

The Marketing Data Engineer is a pivotal role designed for a highly skilled individual capable of architecting and executing sophisticated data solutions to power marketing decisions. They lead the development of data pipelines, warehouses, and marts, specifically crafted to analyze customer interactions and campaign effectiveness. This role demands a deep understanding of both traditional and emerging data sources, including CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce), marketing automation platforms (e.g., Marketo), and various third-party datasets. The Engineer blends technical expertise with strong interpersonal skills to facilitate cross-functional collaboration, ensuring that marketing strategies are informed by accurate, actionable data insights.


**Essential Responsibilities :**


* Develop, construct, test, and maintain architectures (e.g., databases, large-scale data processing systems) ensuring the architecture supports business requirements and delivers maximum value to end users.
* Design, build, and maintain data marts to provide insights into customer behavior, campaign performance, and ROI.
* Implement data flows to connect operational systems, data for analytics, and BI systems.
* Collaborate on the development of marketing tools that leverage data marts for targeted campaign management and customer segmentation.
* Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality.
* Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to provide data in a usable format for analysis and modeling.
* Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies.
* Integrate and manage data from various platforms (e.g., Salesforce, Marketo) and other third-party data providers to enrich marketing data.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, sales, product, and IT departments to ensure the timely and successful delivery of data infrastructure projects.


**Ideal Skills, Experience, and Competencies:**


* At least five (5) years of experience in a similar role (e.g., Data Engineer, Software Developer)
* Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with programming languages (e.g., Python, Java)
* Experience with big data (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka), data pipeline, and workflow management tools
* Familiarity with cloud services (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and database technologies (e.g., Redshift).
* Exhibit strong interpersonal and collaboration skills to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical team members across the organization.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.


**Required Education & Certifications:**


* B.A./B.S. in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Information Technology) or equivalent work experience.
* Master's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Information Technology)

#### **Compensation:**


* Qualified candidates can expect a salary beginning at $110,000 or more depending on experience


#LI-Remote #LI-JF1 #BI-Remote

* Note: Compensation is benchmarked on local Denver Metro area market rates. Qualified candidates in other locations can expect a salary package that may be adjusted based off applicable cost of wages in their respective location.


At Pax8 we believe that your Total Rewards should include a benefits package that shows how much we value our greatest assets. All **FTE** Pax8 people enjoy the following benefits:
* Non-Commissioned Bonus Plans or Variable Commission
* 401(k) plan with employer match
* Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employer Paid Short & Long Term Disability, Life and AD&D Insurance
* Flexible, Open Vacation
* Paid Sick Time Off
* Extended Leave for Life events
* RTD Eco Pass (For local Colorado Employees)
* Career Development Programs
* Stock Option Eligibility
* Employee-led Resource Groups

 Pax8 is an EEOC Employer.

title: Software Developer II
description:
C1 Company Overview:
**C1: 1 Contact, 1 Connection, 1 Choice**  

C1 is the foremost, single-source provider of advanced communications and data technology for business. That means if it's digital, we connect our customers to it - from phone systems and hardware to computer networks, application development, managed solutions and more. And we're 100% passionate with designing, implementing, managing and supporting our customers' every need from end to end, so that they can focus on what they do best.  

So, when it comes to joining a team of IT and communications technology pros who are empowered to do what they do best, your best choice - your #1 choice - is C1.
Overview:

The Software Developer II, will work on a team that includes other software developers along with application administrators who are focused on the day to day support and delivering continuous improvements to our core software applications. The person in this role will act as a Tier 3 support person, working on tickets escalated from our Business Application Administrators. They will also be involved in coding and database updates to resolve issues, as well as performing new development tasks. Additional responsibilities will be helping business analysts pull data for analysis, working to identify and remediate chronic issues, and working on development projects as directed from more senior developers.
Responsibilities:
* Acts as a Tier III support resource to help Identify and research issues within our production systems and make recommendations on possible resolution
* Partners with the application administrators and Tier 1 help desk, to quickly resolve tickets
* Works with application administrators, BA’s and PM’s to perform system and data analysis
* Helps document existing integrations and technical requirements
* Works on internal development projects during code design, development, optimization, deployment and ongoing maintenance
* Deploys software into our QA and Production environments
* Participates in software upgrades
* Gains experience and a broad understanding of current software development techniques methodologies, tools and technologies
* Proposes/implements feasible solutions/processes to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of applications
* Participates in unit and user acceptance testing
* Works independently and deliver on agreed upon timelines
* Participates in the design process of new features and enhancements to existing software


Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s degree with 2-5 year of software development using VB.NET and/or C# with ASP.NET (or 3-5 years of software development using VB.NET and/or C# with ASP.NET)
* 2 years of experience writing Stored Procedures, Functions and Views in MS SQL
* Strong analytical and problem solving skills
* Strong verbal and written communications skills


Desired/Preferred Qualifications* Experience with:
	+ Javascript/HTML/CSS
	+ SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
	+ SQL Triggers
* Exposure to MVC/Razor and Web Services/WCF/Web API
* Customer service experience or technical helpdesk experience
* Experience in Agile development
* Exposure to Microsoft Dynamics CRM, GP and SharePoint


Additional Information:
**C1 BENEFITS**  

  

* 401(k) Plan (35% match per dollar up to 10%)
* Medical Coverage (3 plan options, no network - all providers are covered, includes comprehensive member advocacy; & Kaiser CA plan option)
* HSA + Employer Contribution
* In-vitro Fertility (treatment coverage)
* Dental
* Vision
* FSA Plans
* Pre-tax Commuter Plans
* Employer-paid Life Insurance
* Employer-paid Short + Long Term Disability
* Paid Parental Leave (4 weeks at 100%)
* Employee Assistance Plan
* Voluntary Life Insurance
* Legal/ID Theft Plans
* TeleHealth Options
* Omada Health (healthy living solution)
* Travel Assistance
* Business Travel Accident Coverage
* Employer-paid Pet Telehealth
* Accident Insurance
* Critical Illness Insurance
* Hospital Indemnity Insurance
* Health Advocate
* Volunteer Time Off

  

**Work Environment**  

Ability to handle multiple priorities and demands in a fast-paced environment. This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets.  

  

**Physical Environment**  

Physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this job.  

  

**Other Duties/Changes**  

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of all duties, responsibilities or activities that are required of a team member for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. At any point in time, the essential functions and primary duties associated with this position will be the principal, major or most important duties, responsibilities and activities that the employee is expected to perform as determined and directed by C1.  

  

**EEO Statement**  

C1 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all team members and applicants for employment opportunities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, and all team members will be treated with respect to their employment, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. For further details please view the Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP. http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm **Pay Range**  

$80,000 - $100,000  

Base pay ranges are estimated. Actual base pay will be based on education, experience, location, certifications, skill set, and any other relevant factors. Incentive/variable pay opportunities are in addition to base pay. **Notice of E-Verify Participation**

**Right to Work**

title: IT Data Engineer, Associate
description:
General information
Country
United States


City
Remote Location


Department
Information Technology


Job ID
38648


Description & Requirements
The Associate IT Data Engineer will be responsible for the development, transformation, and ongoing quality management of business data objects sourced from a wide range of internal/external systems with differing storage types. The vision of the Data Management & Analytics (DMA) team is Data Democratization: Partner with our customers to deliver curated information and make value-driven decisions.

  

  

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

* Build required infrastructure for optimal ETL/ELT from various data sources using cloud and non-cloud technologies
* Work with project sponsors and Data Analyst team to document use cases, identify KPIs that can be sourced from available data, and provide feedback and updates on progress and challenges
* Respond timely to issues raised either via system notification or user notice
* Develop and enhance modeled data sets within visualization tools
* Assist Data Analyst team as needed in building visualizations/dashboards
* Maintain security of published data
* Contribute to the overall operational improvement of the DMA team by participating in improvement projects, ensuring standard processes are implemented, and identifying new areas to improve

  


  

Basic Qualifications:

* Previous experience with current low/no code ETL development tools (e.g. Wherescape or Alteryx)
* Previous experience with SQL Server
* Previous experience with visualization and developer tools (e.g. Birst, Domo, Microsoft Power BI, Quick Sight, or Tableau)
* Experience working with Microsoft Office Suite including Microsoft Teams
* Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future

  

  

Preferred Qualifications:

* Previous experience with AWS
* Familiarity with common sales and marketing applications such as Salesforce or other CRM platforms
* Previous experience working with business analysts to assist in defining requirements and setting expectations
* Previous experience with data structuring for complex analyses
* Previous experience with Jira and Sharepoint

  



Remote (Dallas, TX; St. Paul, MN; and Alpharetta, GA)

  

  

  

About Infor  

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
For more information visit www.infor.com  


Our Values  

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.  

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.  

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law.  

  

At Infor we value your privacy that’s why we created a policy that you can read here.  


This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf

title: CRM Analyst (QA)-Salesforce
description:
### **Be essential at Cars Commerce**



At Cars Commerce, we're fanatical about simplifying everything about car buying and selling. We do right by our customers and consumers to better connect the industry with simplified and tierless technology to enhance, measure and drive local automotive retail. Whether through our No.1 most recognized marketplace, **Cars.com**, our industry-leading digital experience, **Dealer Inspire**, our trade and appraisal technology, **AccuTrade**, or our new **Cars Commerce Media Network**, Cars Commerce is essential for success in the automotive industry.



No one ever travels alone here: at its core, Cars Commerce is collaboration. In fact, it's built into the very fabric of our shared values. We like to say we **Rise Together** – putting people at the center of what we do, from consumer to customer to community. Life at Cars Commerce makes it easy when we share the ethos to be **Open to All**, encouraging open-minded communication because we know diverse thinking yields better outcomes. But critical to our success is **Caring to Challenge** and **Taking Ownership**, fueling a competitive spirit in a respectful environment where we think about tomorrow but act today. At our foundation, we have integrity, **Doing the Right Thing**, even when it's hard. It's our shared commitment to these values that makes Cars Commerce a place where growth becomes not only possible, but downright unavoidable.



But don't take our word for it. As a U.S. News & World Report **Best Company to Work For in 2024, we're obsessive about the employee experience**. We are among the top 20% being declared "Best" of our industry based on six critical factors that are important to employee wellbeing, like quality of pay, benefits, work life balance and more.

**Job Scope:**



The CRM Analyst (Salesforce Automation) is a full-time role that works with the CRM (Salesforce) team to support the development, configuration, and maintenance of the multiple Salesforce initiatives of Cars Commerce. They will be responsible for analyzing the needs for system test automation for the Salesforce org and building automation testing suites. This role will work closely with the CRM team to build a broad knowledge of business processes and system configuration to have an understanding of system testing needs and prioritize the testing automation scripts.



The ideal candidate will have a background in Salesforce Automation Testing specifically with tools like Copado Robotic Testing and bring to the team a detail oriented approach to automate the testing of CRM solutions. This person will play a key role in ensuring the **quality and performance** of the Salesforce applications. They will be responsible for designing, developing, and executing automated test scripts and collaborating with the CRM functional team members to deliver high quality solutions. The ideal candidate will also have experience building Salesforce solutions in either an Administrator or Developer role for better understanding in the specific building process of Salesforce solutions.


**Responsibilities include:**


* Collaborate with the development and product teams/business stakeholders to understand requirements and design testing scenarios.
* Develop, maintain, and execute automated test scripts for Salesforce applications using tools like Copado Robotic Testing, Provar, or Selenium.
* Identify, document, and automate test cases and test scenarios.
* Creating and maintaining testing documentation and test plans.
* Performing and automating regression testing.
* Continuously analyze and optimize automated test scripts to increase accuracy and coverage.
* Participate in configuration review and planning sessions to ensure quality and plan new testing automation scripts.
* Keep automated test scripts up-to-date with Salesforce releases and testing tool updates.
* Assist in Salesforce administration and configuration when necessary


 **Required Skills and Experience:**


* Minimum 2 years of test automation experience.
* Minimum 2 years of experience testing Salesforce solutions.
* Minimum 2 years experience translating functional specifications into testing scripts, building testing documentation, regression testing, and building testing automations.
* Proficiency with test automation tools like Copado Robotic Testing, Provar, or Selenium.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to clearly describe software defects and strong troubleshooting skills.
* Analytical and detail oriented mindset with the ability to learn new information quickly.
* Skilled in self managing workload and switching priorities to meet deadlines or changing business needs.
* Collaboration with CRM development teams including Administrators and Developers.
* Hands-on experience with Salesforce Lightning interface.


**Preferred Skills and Experience:**


* Bachelor's degree in related field
* Salesforce administration or development background.
* Experience working with Salesforce Cloud products like Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Revenue Cloud (CPQ), Experience Cloud.
* Agile and Kanban experience a plus.
* Atlassian suite (Jira, Confluence) and LucidChart or experience with similar tools is a plus.
* 2+ years of hands-on Salesforce experience.
* Familiarity with triggers, classes, custom settings, and flow.
* Salesforce Admin Skills.
* Salesforce certifications.

  


**#LI-AK2; #LI-REMOTE**


In the spirit of pay transparency, we are excited to share the base salary range for this position which is not inclusive of bonuses, benefits or other forms of compensation that the position may be eligible for. If you are hired at Cars Commerce, your final base salary compensation will be determined based on factors such as skills and/or experience. If the salary range is close to what you're seeking, then we encourage you to apply and learn more about the total compensation package for this position.

**Salary Range**


$80,100—$98,100 USD**Our Comprehensive Benefits Package includes:**


* Medical, Dental & Vision Healthcare Plans
* 401(k) with Company Match + Immediate Vesting
* New Hire Stipend for Home Office Set-Up
* Employee Stock Purchase Program
* Generous PTO
* Refuel - a service based recognition program where employees receive additional paid time away to learn grow and reset
* Paid Holidays, Floating Holiday, Volunteer Day, Recharge Day
* Learn more about our Benefits, Perks, & Culture on our LinkedIn Life Pages!


*We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. California Applicants: Click* *here* *to review our California Privacy Policy for Applicants. For current employees, please click* *here* *to review our California Privacy Policy for Employees.*

title: Microsoft Dynamics CRM Developer
description:
Need a seasoned **D365 Project Operations techno-functional consultant** 

* Sit in an end user shoes, identify their needs and translate them into practical solutions with a passion for operational process efficacy.
* Innovative Operations projects, and look forward to guiding clients through their move to D365 POps from legacy systems and add value to their business processes.
* Leads the delivery team through all stages of the project to include analyse, design, develop, test and deploy.
* Provides the overall direction of the design, solution, development, and oversight.
* Initial and primary point of customer contact for all delivery project concerns and issues throughout the delivery cycle of Project Operations module
* Reviews, and provides guidance for developing high level and detailed architecture, data migration, data integration, security model etc

**Skills:**

* Expert knowledge of D365 Project Operations, formerly known as D365 Project Services Automation (PSA)
* 5+ years of MS Dynamics 365 CE and Project Operations/Project Service Automation experience
* Good knowledge of D365 F&O and how it inter-operates with D365 Project Operations
* Lead functional workshops with clients, document requirements, and design appropriate solutions or workarounds at the least
* Lead and work with the client and internal teams with Architects that represent other line of business applications like Finance and Operations, Data & Analytics, etc
* Has a solid grasp of migration, integration, D365 line of business application capabilities, and CE technical and functional capabilities
* Working knowledge of PowerApps, Power Automate, Azure, Office 365, Azure Data Factory, and other related technologies including automation
* Competent, capable, and familiar with all aspects of D365 delivery projects
* Work with the client, internal teams and Microsoft (product vendor) on infrastructure requirements, implementation, and configuration or any procut
* Exposure to Microsoft Licensing will be a value add.

**Product Capabilities/Functional/Domain Knowledge:**

* Deal management experience
* Customize resource-based costing and pricing
* Use deal structures tailored for project-based organizations
* Manage pipeline with a unified sales dashboard
* Worked on enhanced project management capabilities
* Estimate and track projects to budget
* Collaboration features across the project lifecycle
* Forecast trends for the duration of a project
* Optimize resource utilization and intelligent scheduling
* Simplify time tracking and expense management
* Tracking business performance through streamlined project financials
* Recognize revenue accurately and on time
* Improve cash flow by invoicing customers quickly
* Manage project accounting with higher accuracy
* Exposure to making a service-centric ERP system
* Improve visibility for greater business impact
* Visualize key insights for fast, informed decisions
* Democratize data to eliminate silos
* Create forecasting snapshots

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $70.00 - $72.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* It's a W2 role , are you comfortable working on W2 ?
* What is your visa status ?

Experience:

* Adobe Experience Manager: 1 year (Preferred)
* Microsoft Dynamics 365: 1 year (Preferred)
* project operations: 1 year (Preferred)
* deal management: 1 year (Preferred)
* Azure data factory: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Web Developer
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------


Nickerson is a full-service branding, marketing, public relations, and communications agency. With collective expertise in real estate, hospitality, technology, lifestyle, non-profit organizations, and architecture, engineering, and construction, the Nickerson team elevates the experiential journey and serves as a trusted, global partner to elite, forward-thinking brands.



We are looking for a Web Developer to join our growing Branding, Design & Web team. He/She/They will be responsible for both front-end and back-end development of WordPress websites and third-party API integrations.


**Must submit a portfolio with links to live websites for consideration.**


**Responsibilities:**
---------------------

* Develop, deploy, and maintain scalable WordPress websites
* Integrate WordPress websites with third-party APIs
* Maintain a strong understanding of website building platforms: WordPress (required), WooCommerce (as a plus), and Squarespace (as a plus)
* Collaborate with CS team members during all phases of website develop to ensure concepts can be implemented
* Have a deep understanding for responsive design across desktop, tablet, and mobile views
* Understanding of SEO best practices and how to leverage them to enhance website performance
* Have a finger on the pulse of web design trends, platform updates and other software related to WordPress
* Ability to troubleshoot occasional website issues
* Implement development quickly, independently, or collaboratively
**Desired Skills & Qualifications:**
------------------------------------

* Skilled in developing WordPress websites that are semantic, scalable, and maintainable
* 2+ years proven work experience as a developer
* Proficient understanding of front-end technologies, including PHP, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
* Knowledge of the BEM naming convention
* Ability to understand CSS changes and their ramifications to ensure consistency across platforms and browsers
* Ability to clearly communicate ideas, concepts, and solutions to team members with varying degrees of technical knowledge
* Experience with JavaScript libraries and frameworks
* Experience integrating WordPress with third-party APIs
* Yardi, RealPage, Enquire, Salesforce, and HubSpot integrations experience is a plus
* Experience troubleshooting browser errors and optimizing WordPress websites for performance
* Proficient in converting a Figma website designs into maintainable WordPress websites
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
* Proven ability to manage client relationships via CRM
* Experience with Harvest or equivalent time tracking software
* Experience with Asana or equivalent project management tracking software
* Experience engaging with or presenting to clients
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment under tight deadlines
* Experience managing vendors and orders on behalf of clients
* Knowledge of the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) is a plus
* Email marketing, Mailchimp/Constant Contact or Pardot experience is a plus
* Member of a marketing/design industry-related club or organization is a plus
* 2 years+ experience in marketing/design creation, preferably in the real estate, lifestyle, restaurant, and hospitality sectors
* High level of attention to detail
* Must be organized in a digital workspace and comfortable working remotely
**Benefits and Culture:**
-------------------------

* **Remote Work** – Nickerson is a fully-remote team. We offer the opportunity to work from anywhere.
* **Diversity & Inclusion** – We are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive professional environment. We encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply – we value each team member’s unique perspective and know they make our team stronger.
* **Healthcare** – Our comprehensive healthcare package includes medical, dental, and vision care.
* **Life Insurance** – Nickerson offers life insurance in addition to long- and short-term disability insurance.
* **Unlimited PTO** – Nickerson offers unlimited paid time off, in addition to 10 federal holidays. Team members also get their birthdays off! Woo hoo!
* **Equitable Compensation** – Nickerson is committed to an equitable compensation philosophy. By leveraging industry benchmarks and combining objective and performance-based criteria, we ensure fair and transparent salary decisions.
* **Business Development Bonus** – Nickerson encourages all team members to share our greatness with the world! We offer business development bonuses to team members who introduce us to new client-partners.
* **401(K)** – Nickerson offers a 401(K) plan with 5% company match to help you save for retirement. We also offer a financial advisor who can help you with your investment options.
* **Coaching** – We want you to be the best version of yourself and offer training and coaching to help you recognize your strengths and build upon them.
* **Involvement** – We encourage all team members to participate at a leadership level in industry organizations.
* **Reimbursement** – Nickerson reimburses team-members $250 dollars each quarter for internet and utility expenses.
* **Philanthropy** – Nickerson is committed to helping organizations drive social change and improve the communities in which we live and work. If a team member holds a leadership role with a charity, Nickerson will contribute $500 annually in recognition of their efforts.
* **Cheers!** – Each week, we hold our “Cheers” meeting to celebrate team members’ accomplishments and recognize each other for outstanding work.
**Mission, Vision, and Core Values:**
-------------------------------------

**Our Mission:** We elevate the experiential journey  

**Our Vision:** We serve as a trusted, global partner for elite, forward thinking brands


* **Team First** – We are a group of individuals who both depend on each other and hold one another accountable. We emphasize collaboration and team work to achieve excellence together.

title: Staff Engineer, Commerce Solutions
description:
**About LeafLink**
------------------



LeafLink is the largest unified B2B cannabis platform, providing licensed cannabis businesses a suite of tools to manage their business more effectively, sell or order from their favorite brands and accelerate growth. We are one platform, one solution and we're defining the way thousands of cannabis brands, distributors and retailers streamline their operations. With thousands of brands and retailers across 30+ markets in North America, we are setting the industry standard for how cannabis businesses grow together. LeafLink processes more than $4.4 billion in wholesale cannabis orders annually.



Our team, backed by funding from leading VC's, including Founders Fund, Thrive Capital, Nosara Capital, and Lerer Hippeau is poised to define the cannabis supply chain through technology. LeafLink was named one of Inc. 5000's 'Top 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies', one of Built In NYC's 'Best Places to Work in 2021', as well as one of Fast Company's 'Top 10 Most Innovative Companies in Enterprise for 2020', joining the ranks of Amazon, Slack, and VMWare - and we're just getting started!

**The Role**
------------



LeafLink is seeking a Staff Software Engineer for Commerce Solutions to join our remote-friendly team, headquartered in NYC. We desire someone passionate about working with teams that solve interesting, large-scale problems at a rapid pace. This role will focus on the design, buildout, and iteration of LeafLink's existing and emerging eCommerce technology systems, enabling a new and massive revenue stream as well as modernizing LeafLink's ad technology. As a senior member of our engineering team, you will have a direct and lasting impact everywhere in the business. Your contribution will be immediate and have positive ripple effects across not only our business but each customer's business, as well!



LeafLink is currently gearing up to tackle a large-scale platform overhaul that will strengthen our position as a leader within the industry. As such, this role has the opportunity to help shape and grow this new platform and work within new and growing technologies. It's an exciting time to join our engineering team!



Ideal candidates for this position should possess a keen mind for solving tough problems with the ideal solution, partnering effectively with various team members along the way. They should be personable, efficient, flexible, and communicative, have a strong desire to implement change, grow, mature, and have a passion and love for their work. This role comes with the opportunity to be a high performer within a fast-paced, dynamic, and quickly growing department.


**What You'll Be Doing**
------------------------


* Design, build, and iterate on various parts of our Seller Experiences (Inventory, CRM, Product Menu) as well as our ad offerings
* Architect a robust solution to recommend more relevant products to retailers to help increase discovery and maximize their margins
* Lead by example for other members of the team as a dedicated, passionate, and flexible technologist who is constantly looking for the ideal solution to a problem
* Set and drive the architectural design and development objectives that enable us to re-platform and scale our eCommerce marketplace tools based on a flexible product roadmap
* Review and develop architecture plans based on product-driven goals for both internal and external teams, ensuring our department's core engineering values remain a priority
* Be seen as "the person" by team members - leading by example as a dedicated, flexible technologist who is always looking for the ideal, elegant solution to a problem while still making sure to partner effectively with other areas of the department and company
* Help make critical software design decisions that will have a lasting impact on LeafLink's platform and products as well as lead and mentor others to do the same
* Keep up to date on modern technologies and trends and advocate for their inclusion within products when it makes sense
* Analyze and evaluate existing solutions within the company and make decisions on whether to extend or refactor as needed
* Drive technical roadmaps that bring commercial value to the company.
* Work collaboratively with multiple agile teams to help deliver end-to-end products and features, seeing them through from conception to delivery
* Be able to troubleshoot and diagnose issues quickly and effectively when they arise, bringing calm and rationality to tense situations and providing a clear path forward for team members across multiple areas of the department
* Provide technical leadership and help mentor engineering, QA, operations, and product staff to deliver the best possible solutions for the company
* Help define, document, evolve, and evangelize high engineering standards and best practices across multiple areas
* Move quickly and intelligently - seeing technical debt as your nemesis

**What You'll Bring to the Team**
---------------------------------


* 10+ years working with B2B marketplace or eCommerce technical systems, with an understanding of industry best practices regarding invoicing, reconciliation, order lifecycles, and notification frameworks
* Ideal candidates will have experience in highly regulated industries with heavy compliance requirements, e.g. Healthcare, Cannabis, Financial products
* Expert-level experience and track record of architecting large-scale decoupled, event-driven, service-oriented systems
* Extensive experience working on high-traffic, international systems
* Extensive experience refactoring legacy systems in an iterative fashion
* Experience working in and advocating for agile environments
* Expert-level experience working with APIs / in an API-driven environment (REST, RPC, GraphQL), ideally including outbound webhooks and the associated self-service infrastructure required to support a productive developer experience
* Proven track record of practical, thoughtful problem-solving
* Expert-level experience working with one or more of the following: Python/Flask, Node
* Extensive experience building applications and underlying systems that work within fully containerized environments (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Extensive experience working with relational and non-relational data structures and stores
* Advanced experience working in an environment that sees test-driven development as a core value and a path toward ensuring stability
* Experience working within environments that rely heavily on automation, CI, and CD concepts to rapidly deliver, measure, and iterate on products and features
* Experience working within cloud-based environments like AWS and GCP - specifically related to networking, computing, database, cache, and storage services
* Advanced knowledge of front-end technologies like Javascript (Vue, React), CSS (Sass, SCSS), templating engines (JSX, Twig, etc.), and build systems (Gulp, Webpack)
* Experience working within a collaborative, pair programming-driven engineering environment
* An active member of the open-source community a plus
* Well-versed in version control systems (Git)
* An interest in the cannabis industry and/or the LeafLink brand

**LeafLink Perks & Benefits**
-----------------------------


* **Flexible PTO** - you're going to be working hard so enjoy time off with no cap!
* A robust **stock option plan** to give our employees a direct stake in LeafLink's success
* **5 Days of Volunteer Time Off (VTO)** - giving back is important to us and we want our employees to prioritize cultivating a better community
* **Competitive compensation** and **401k**
* Comprehensive **health** **coverage** (medical, dental, vision)
* **Commuter Benefits** through our Flexible Spending Account


*LeafLink's employee-centric culture has earned us a coveted spot on**BuiltInNYC's Best Places to Work for in 2021 list.* *Learn more about LeafLink's history and the path to our First Billion in Wholesale Cannabis Orders**here**.*

**Base salary range**


$200,000—$215,000 USD

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
**Job Title:** Senior/Lead Salesforce Developer (LWC/Aura)

**Location:** 100% Remote | Baltimore, MD

**Duration:** 1 Year

**Job Description:**

Senior/Lead Salesforce Developer to work on the Salesforce platform and provide IT development in support of Marketplace initiatives.

This position is 100% remote with work schedules based on Eastern Standard Time (EST).

Contract requires candidate must have lived in the United States at least three (3) out of the last five (5) years.

* 75% of this role involves programming, using Apex, Salesforce lightning component (AURA/LWC), JavaScript, and other development languages and tools once fully onboarded. Candidate selected will either be a Lead (Development Lead for their Scrum Team) or Senior Developer, depending on the opening available when selected.
* Develop Lightning components both by writing custom LWC in JavaScript with Aura framework and within the Salesforce Lightning Design System, maintaining fluency with Apex, Salesforce query, and Salesforce Search language (SOQL and SOSL).
* Support the Product Owner in gathering requirements by providing solution options and highlighting dependencies with the existing implementation.
* Oversee the end-to-end architecture of the Salesforce Platform {Salesforce Service Cloud, Experience Cloud (Portals), and Tableau CRM} and integrations.
* Develop and configure solutions using Salesforce functionality/Lightning Components (AURA and LWC), APEX, Visualforce Pages, SOQL, and SOSL etc.
* Lead the complete development process from requirement analysis to deployment.
* Review and provide feedback on technical implementations and documents and ensure that Salesforce best-practices and standards are followed.
* Collaborate with junior developers to perform code reviews and provide feedback.
* Create and maintain technical documentation including process documentation, naming, and commenting conventions and Salesforce policies/procedures.
* Mentor and provide guidance to the development team members.
* Participate in the full application life cycle - design, development, testing, and deployment.
* Assist in identifying, troubleshooting, and resolving defects encountered during various stages of project delivery, including during the deployment and implementation of the solution in production environments.
* Collaborate with Solutions Architects, Development Manager, Development Team, Business Analysts, CMS, and other Agile team members to solve complex policy and system integration involving activities across several Salesforce Orgs.

**Education:**

* Bachelor’s degree
* Possess Valid Salesforce Platform Developer I Certification - Please include Trailblazer link and/or certification # on resume.
* Possess Valid Salesforce Platform Developer II Certification - Please include Trailblazer link and/or certification # on resume.

**Required Experience:**

* 10+ years of hands-on programming/custom coding experience with Salesforce platform, requiring LWC AND Apex.
* Experience should also include: SLDS, Visualforce, Triggers, Batch classes, SOQL, SOSL and declarative platform tools (Flows, Process builder, Lightning App Builder, etc.).
* 3+ years of hands-on experience leading implementation of custom solutions on the Salesforce platform in Lightning and have expert level working knowledge on major Salesforce.com technologies, data modeling, integration, and data migration.
* Extensive understanding of Salesforce.com best practices, Architecture, Design, Development, Administration, and security model.
* Working knowledge and experience with complex business systems integration, such as with Copado, as well as object-oriented design patterns and development.
* Extensive understanding of Salesforce Service Cloud and Experience Cloud (Communities) development and customization.
* Experience with SFDC specific IDE and version control configurations (Github, BitBucket) for Salesforce development (VS Code, IntelliJ, SFDX)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to present ideas to various levels/skillsets, both internally and externally.
* Provide technical assistance and end user troubleshooting for bug fixes, enhancements, and “how-to” assistance.
* Ability to multitask between multiple projects and both business and technical stakeholders.

**Security Clearance Level:**

* Candidate must be willing and able to obtain a Public Trust clearance.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Hands-on experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Development (CI/CD)/Copado
* Extensive understanding of HTML, CSS, XML, JavaScript, jQuery, and Bootstrap.
* Experience in development of Web Services (SOAP and REST)
* Healthcare Service Industry or Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) experience
* Experience working with JIRA, Confluence, and SharePoint
* Experience with infrastructure in a cloud environment (AWS preferred)
* Experience with Agile methodologies and frameworks such as, but not limited to: SAFe, Scrum, Kanban
* Certified SAFe Agilist, SAFe Practitioner or other Agile certification(s)

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $70.00 - $80.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Experience level:

* 11+ years
* 3 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: (Remote) CRM Administrator - Information Technology Services
description:
Information Technology Services at West Virginia University is currently accepting applications for a (Remote) CRM Administrator.


**About the Opportunity:**



As the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Administrator, you be a hands-on technical Salesforce position. You will report to the Assistant Director of Systems of Engagement.



We strongly believe in work-life balance and keeping time for things we love outside our work. WVU offers generous benefits, including:


* 37.5-hour work week
* 13 paid holidays (staff holiday calendar)
* 24 annual leave (vacation) days per year (employee leave)
* 18 sick days per year (for when you’re ill, for when you need time to care for sick family, for your own, or your family’s, regularly scheduled medical appointments. Who is family for the purpose of this leave? A lot of people in your life including immediate relatives and in-laws as well as others considered to be members of your household living under the same roof)
* WVU offers a range of health insurance and other benefits
* 401(a) retirement savings with 6% employee contribution match, eligibility to continue health insurance, and other retiree perks. Looking for more retirement benefits information? Check out retirement health insurance benefits, retirement income, and FAQ’s.
* Wellness programs


**What You'll Do:**


* Experience customizing and enhancing an organization’s Salesforce instance.
* Demonstrated experience with Salesforce - sales cloud, service cloud, education cloud, experience cloud and marketing cloud, and third-party tools such as Conga Suite, DemandTools, Rollup Helper, SMS, Ownbackup. Assist with ETL integrations like Informatica Cloud and Axiom.
* Knowledge of profiles, roles, permissions, groups, sharing rules and field level security and how each effect a user’s access.
* Responsible for providing application administration, troubleshooting and support for information technology projects, applications and systems. This includes code migration, change control, application security, performance and availability.
* Assists in testing and verification for internal custom code and vendor software releases, patches, and add-ons.
* Collaborates with the CRM team to proactively identify and recommend operational improvements, enhancements and system customizations that meet business needs and ensure solutions that are usable, scalable, easy to maintain.
* Assist the technical leads and work with technical and functional staff within CRM team as well as developers, database and systems administrators to ensure system availability along with performing regular testing of business continuity plans.
* Provide 24x7 service by being on call in rotation with other staff to ensure continuous availability of the production systems.
* Possesses ability to interpret and monitor application logs in order to identify potential issues and then work with appropriate IT units and vendors to mitigate any issues.
* May be asked by Senior Management to provide reports, technical expertise and training.
* Evaluate current or emerging technologies. Assess current or future needs and priorities through direct communication, surveys or other methods with the users.
* Collaborate with various university departments and campuses to increase efficiency and ensure daily operational tasks are completed in a timely manner.
* Create or update technical documentation including but not limited to system configuration, infrastructure, and integration specifications.
* Performs other necessary and appropriate duties as directed by Senior Management.

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
	+ A degree in Computer science, computer engineering or Management Information Systems or related is a plus.
* A minimum of two (2) years of combined experience in the following:
	+ Application Administration with Customer Relationship Management system - Salesforce and Enterprise level systems
	+ Knowledge of ETL tools like Informatica/ Axiom.
* Ability to clearly communicate highly technical concepts to both technical experts and non-technical users and management.
* Strong oral & written communication, customer relationship and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated proficiency in problem solving, the ability to self-direct and prioritize tasks.
* Strong analytical skills to be able to research, analyze, detect and technically correct developed processes.
* Customer focus, team oriented, ability to adapt and respond to change, adhering to principles and values.
* Creative and Innovative, results driven.
* Excellent time management and organizational skills.
* Comfortable in a fast-paced and constantly evolving environment.
* Knowledge of Customer Relationship Management – Salesforce which includes Sales cloud, Service cloud, Education Cloud, Experience Cloud and Marketing Cloud.
* Knowledge of profiles, roles, permissions, groups, sharing rules and field level security and how each effect a user’s access.
* Ability to analyze situations, identify cause, and provide valid solutions in situations quickly and logically.
* Experience with integrations such as ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) tools like Informatica and Axiom
* Demonstrated ability to prepare technical documentation and justify approach used, resolve complex issues, explain and/or train staff on technical features of an application or process, and the ability to express technical information to non-technical users as well as gather information from them relating to system needs and issues.
**About WVU**  

At West Virginia University, we leverage our talents and resources to create a better future for our state and the world. As West Virginia's land-grant university, WVU has three campuses that touch each corner of the state. The WVU System includes 518 buildings on 15,880 acres, Extension Service offices in all 55 counties, ten experimental farms and four forests.  

  

From the groundbreaking R1 research of our flagship campus in Morgantown to the career-oriented programs of WVU Potomac State in Keyser to the technology-intensive programs at WVU Tech in Beckley — the contributions of WVU employees directly impact the 1.8 million people of West Virginia every day, no matter their role or position.



Service, curiosity, respect, accountability, and appreciation are the core values that unite Mountaineers, inspiring one another to work tirelessly and support others as they seek to reach new heights. After all, when you're a Mountaineer, impossible is just another mountain to climb.  

  

Creating an inclusive, engaged, and dynamic learning environment is core to WVU’s academic mission. We welcome candidates who can contribute a range of ideas, approaches and experiences.



West Virginia University is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer and is the recipient of an NSF ADVANCE award for gender equity. The University values diversity among its faculty, staff, and students, and invites applications from all qualified applicants regardless of race, ethnicity, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, nationality, genetics, disability, or Veteran status.

  

**Job Posting****:** Feb 29, 2024**Posting Classification****:** Non-Classified**Exemption Status****:** Exempt**Benefits Eligible****:** Yes**Schedule****:** Full-time

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
.


The Salesforce Developer will be responsible for supporting the ongoing maintenance and development of our Salesforce ecosystem. This person will work closely with the Commercial Operations team to develop and deploy new business processes including but not limited to: Marketing, Sales, Account Management, Deployment, Client Onboarding and Client Services. In this role, the successful candidate will be primarily focusedon Apex, automations, integrations and Flows but will also serve as administrator as needed. This role will focus 70% on development work, and 30% on administration work. This person will keep current on new releases and AppExchange solutions, participate in release management/regression testing and more. This person will be a part of our Commercial Systems team.


The successful candidate must have demonstrated experience in maintaining and enhancing an ongoing Salesforce CRM implementation and building and developing efficient processes.


**Your day to day role will include:**

* Support Salesforce.com data feeds and other conversions, consolidations, and integrations with the marketing automation platform (Pardot), ServiceNow and other platforms as needed
* Complete regular internal system audits to ensure clean data and processes. Prepare for and regression test upgrades and releases
* Work independently and collaborate with others to deliver effective solutions to meet business requirements. The person in this role should be able to review, troubleshoot and fix currently existing solutions in our Salesforce org (including Flows and Apex)
* Working with product owner and business analysts to estimate scope of product backlog and meet deadlines
* Routinely testing the stability and functionality of the application, recommending performance improvements where possible
* Managing cases to troubleshoot and fix bugs as assigned, writing technical and functional specs and documenting solutions in ticketing system
* Maintaining the security and integrity of the application and abiding by R1 IT policies and procedures

**You Have:**

* Bachelor's Degree in Business Management or Computer Sciences.
* Strong project management skills and a positive attitude
* Consider yourself a lifelong learner
* Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, handle and prioritize simultaneous requests, and manage laterally and upwards
* Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Ability to assess the impact of new requirements on Salesforce.com and all upstream and downstream applications, systems, and processes
* Prefer 2-5 years’ experience working in Salesforce, with strong Flow, Apex, automation and org development skills.
* Understanding of the Lightning platform, with the ability to configure custom apps and objects, formula fields, flows, and custom views. Commitment to configure first, code only when required.
* Technical knowledge in these areas preferred:
	+ Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Experience Cloud
	+ Lightning components – LWC
	+ Apex, JavaScript, HTML, Visualforce, CSS, XML, JSON
	+ SOSL, SOQL, SQL
	+ API (REST, Bulk)
	+ Standard Workflows, Triggers, Flows, Process builder (along with a good understanding of which is appropriate solution for the problem)
* Good understanding of Governor limits and bulkifying code when needed
* Salesforce Architecture experience – understanding of best practices, documentation
* Salesforce Administrator Certification required, additional certifications are preferred such as Platform Developer 1
* MS Office skills

**It would be great if you also have:**

* Project management experience, preferably Agile methodology
* Experience with Conga or other CLM
* Experience with Snowflake, DataLake, Power BI
* Experience with Aprika Mission Control
* Experience with integrated MAP platform (Pardot, Hubspot)
* Experience with VS Code and use of Salesforce CLI
* Experience with Gearset (or other DevOps tool)
* Integration experience
* Healthcare operations or software experience

For this US-based position, the base pay range is $63,140.06 - $143,517.00 per year . Individual pay is determined by role, level, location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.
Learn more about Benefits at R1


Working in an evolving healthcare setting, we use our shared expertise to deliver innovative solutions. Our fast-growing team has opportunities to learn and grow through rewarding interactions, collaboration and the freedom to explore professional interests.  



  

Our associates are given valuable opportunities to contribute, to innovate and create meaningful work that makes an impact in the communities we serve around the world. We also offer a culture of excellence that drives customer success and improves patient care. We believe in giving back to the community and offer a competitive benefits package including:


* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & RX Coverage
* Paid Time Off, Volunteer Time & Holidays
* 401K with Company Match
* Company-Paid Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability & Long-Term Disability

title: UI/UX Developer - Salesforce
description:
**Position Summary:** CoreSphere is hiring a Salesforce UI/UX Developer to support our state client in a Health and Human Services (HHS) project. Our client is currently licensed for the use of the Salesforce Platform. Within this licensing there are several communities that have pre-built resources that allow for the rapid development of services available to the Division using a low code, no code maxim. This rapid development will allow the division to provide multiple solutions at no additional licensing cost to individual business units. The UI/UX Developer will design, document, and review detailed design specifications, system specifications, and program specific requirements to create UX/UI design solutions that balance platform capabilities and design solutions to keep with low code/ no code approach. This position is 100% remote.  

  

**\\*\\*Note:** Must have Salesforce User Experience Designer Certification.  

  

**Responsibilities:*** Leverage Salesforce Public Sector foundation (Formerly Vlocity) configuration and/or customization to build and deliver Salesforce UX/UI design solutions that meet business requirements.
* Perform Analysis, coding, testing, debugging, implementation, and documentation.
* Create UX/UI designs of varying complexity leveraging the Salesforce Public Sector (Vlocity) platform that interface with desktop and mobile platforms.
* Create integrations using Salesforce APIs to integrate with other systems used in the State, including legacy systems.
* Code review custom developed code and make necessary technical adjustments and recommendations.
* Manage organization-wide defaults, configuring permission sets, establishing role hierarchies, writing workflow rules.
* Maintaining the code base and ensuring it remains consistent with the overall application architecture.
* Adhere to industry standard practice for ADA access by utilizing Knowledge of WCAG AA standards.
* Present, communicate, and document design work to internal teams and key stakeholders.
* Design wireframes, prototypes, user flows, interaction prototypes, user personas, storyboard customer journeys, site maps, and other design specification material.
* Design custom user interfaces for specific business needs, including custom components and lightning web components.
* Design user interfaces that are responsive and work well on multiple devices, including desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
* Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties through design and experience within design.
* Collaborate effectively with developers and stakeholders to ensure that the user interface design is implemented correctly and meets business requirements and state User Experience guidelines.
* Perform basic platform configuration (objects, fields, page layouts, etc.), creating reports and dashboards, and data management.
* Collaborate with Salesforce administrators on release cycles to deploy new functionality and updates to existing applications, objects, and code.

**Skills and Technologies:*** 5 years of experience and expertise with WCAG AA standards.
* 5 years of experience with Salesforce’s declarative development tools, including Visualforce, Lightning Components, and Salesforce Lightning Design System (SLDS).
* 5 years of experience implementing wireframes and design solutions with Adobe Photoshop and InDesign.
* 4 years of experience with front-end web development technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery.
* 4 years of experience with APEX, SOQL, Creating Workflows, SDLC, Agile SCRUM.
* Strong foundation in the underlying Salesforce Public Sector data model and keeping with a ‘Salesforce Public Sector First’ approach in mind.
* Familiar with front-end web development technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery.
* Experience working with Salesforce’s declarative development tools, including Visualforce, Lightning Components, and Salesforce Lightning Design System (SLDS).
* Expertise in setting up environments for Salesforce public sector solutions.
* Preferred experience: Copado, Omni studio/Vlocity.
* **Required Certification:** Salesforce User Experience Designer Certification.

**Work Authorization/Security Clearance:** Must be able to pass a public trust background check.  

  

**Interviews:** Please be advised that CoreSphere will be confirming each applicant’s identity at the beginning of our video interviews. We will ask you to hold up an official US Government issued Photo ID with scrubbed out privacy information.  

  

**Company Overview:** CoreSphere, LLC is a fast-growing Salesforce Crest Partner and ServiceNow Elite Partner established in 2003 to develop state of the art solutions for public and private sector organizations. We make it possible for our clients to achieve their management and IT Transformation goals through the innovative use of management techniques and information technology. Our solution focus includes Cloud and mobile solutions, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Customer Service and Case Management, Human Resources Information Systems, Business Intelligence, Program/Project Management, Acquisition Management, Systems Integration.  

  

**Benefits:*** Competitive Pay
* Paid Time Off
* Sick Leave
* Public Holidays
* STD/LTD
* Health and Dental
* 401(k)


Employment at CoreSphere is contingent upon clear and clean results of a thorough background check.  

*CoreSphere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered regardless of a person's race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, military status, sex, gender expression or identity, or sexual orientation.*
