title: Sales Intern
description:
We are looking for a passionate and results-driven Sales Intern to join our Education/EdTech team. As a Sales Intern, you will play a vital role in promoting and selling Learning Management System.


Job Type : **Full Time**  


Location : **Gurgaon**
  
Sales Intern (Education/EdTech – Learning Management System) We are looking for a passionate and results-driven Sales Intern to join our Education/EdTech team. As a Sales Intern, you will play a vital role in promoting and selling Learning Management System (LMS) solutions of ISM SOFTSOL to educational institutions and organizations. This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the education technology industry while contributing to the growth and success of our LMS vertical of business. The internship also offers opportunity to get absorbed as full-time employee based on successful delivery during internship period. 

Responsibilities:

* Sales Support
* Assist the sales team in lead generation, prospecting, and identifying potential clients within the education sector.
* Conduct research on educational institutions and organizations to understand their needs and pain points related to learning management and e-learning solutions.

Product Presentation and Demonstration:

* Collaborate with the sales team to prepare and deliver compelling product presentations and demonstrations to potential clients.
* Showcase the features and benefits of our LMS to address the specific needs of educational institutions.

Lead Nurturing and Follow-Up:

* Support the sales team in nurturing leads and maintaining regular communication with prospects.
* Follow up on inquiries, emails, and calls to keep potential clients engaged throughout the sales process.

Sales Collateral and Materials:

* Assist in creating sales collateral, including brochures, presentations, case studies, and product documentation.
* Ensure that all sales materials are up-to-date, accurate, and align with the company’s brand and messaging.

Sales Pipeline Management:

* Help maintain and update the sales pipeline and CRM system with accurate and relevant information.
* Track progress of leads, prospects, and opportunities to assist the sales team in meeting sales targets.

Market Research:

* Stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and developments in the education technology and e-learning space.
* Share insights and observations with the sales team to support strategic decision-making.

Customer Relationship Management:

* Collaborate with the sales team to build and maintain strong relationships with clients and prospects.
* Gather feedback from customers to understand their satisfaction levels and areas for improvement.

Requirements:

* Bacherlor’s or master’s degree in marketing, Business, Market Research, or related fields.
* Background or coursework in education or edtech is a plus.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Enthusiasm for sales and a passion for the education technology industry.
* Knowledge of Learning Management Systems or e-learning platforms is an advantage.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and familiarity with CRM tools.

Duration and Compensation:

* This is a 3-6 months internship position.
* The internship may be paid or unpaid, depending on the company’s policy and the candidate’s qualifications.

Conclusion Remark for Internship Post

* Join our team as a Sales Intern in the Education/EdTech industry and be part of our mission to transform education through innovative Learning Management System solutions. This internship will provide you with valuable sales experience and insights into the dynamic and ever-evolving education technology market. Apply now and contribute to shaping the future of e-learning!
 **Why head into the battlefield unprepared?** We work with ideas that inspire, engage and excite. Ideas that challenge convention and shape the trends. Through our awe-inspiring personal touch.


  
**Why you will love it here?**We want to foster individuality, and love to work with all kinds of people - quirks and all.

**#1****Creative Freedom**
At ISM, individuality is celebrated. We embrace diverse perspectives and welcome all kinds of people, quirks and all. Your unique insights and creativity will flourish here.**#2****Innovative Environment**
We're not just a company; we're a playground for ideas. We foster an environment where innovation thrives. If you have a knack for creative solutions, you'll feel right at home.**#3****Collaborative Vibes**
Join forces with a cross-discipline team of product managers, strategists, UX designers, directors, and developers. Our collaborative spirit fuels collective success.**#4****Attention to Detail**
We appreciate the beauty of detail. If you're the type who notices the subtleties and believes in the power of precision, you'll fit right in.**#5****Professional Growth**
We invest in our team's growth. Expect opportunities for skill development, project management, and exposure to QA methodology and agile frameworks.**#6****Inclusivity Matters**
We value teamwork and great personalities. You'll have the chance to work with team players who radiate positivity and are fantastic collaborators.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================


We are looking for an CPQ Software Engineer to lead the growth of GE Electrification Software quoting environment. The CPQ Software Engineer will be responsible for the overall planning, execution, and success of complex software solutions to meet the business needs while exemplifying technical excellence and productivity for the rest of the team.
  

  

The ideal candidate has extensive background in implementing Oracle CPQ platform for B2B.  

Must be experienced in configuring products, bundles, licensing, subscription and invoice management, set-up of complex product catalogs and advanced pricing including escalators.**Job Description**
===================

**Roles and Responsibilities:**

* Design, Develop and support configurations, commerce, document designer, BOM, ABO, BML Coding, integrations, reports, workflow, and custom development in Oracle CPQ.
* Continuously partner with Product Owners and Business Stakeholders to gain in-depth business knowledge to support the business needs.
* Partners with product owners and scrum team members to deliver against goals and business requirements.
* Participate in story design, grooming, estimation calls with Developers, BA’s, architects and Product Owners.
* Develop robust, scalable, interoperable, and flexible solutions that scale horizontally and vertically.
* Design, configure, and develop custom code/objects using the CPQ developer toolkit.
* Develop web services API integrations with other systems including CRM/ERP systems.
* Independently work on user stories, including configurations, unit test scripts, deployments and documentation.
* Plans, documents, and executes unit test plans to ensure all code changes meet requirements, and specifications.
* Work with Oracle and external vendors to resolve technical and functional issues.
* Actively collaborate with various functional teams during quarterly Oracle cloud upgrades to ensure smooth transition.
* Keeping up-to date on adoption of new features released on the platform.

**Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math)
* 5+ years of Development Experience on Oracle CPQ (Big Machines)
* 1+ years of experience working on HTML, CSS, JSON, XML, XSLT and JavaScript.
* 1+ years of experience with implementing subscription-based projects.
* Active Oracle CPQ certification is a must.
* Experience Working on Doc Designer, Email Designer, Approvals modifications, Workflows with advanced BML/BMQL scripting.

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Experience in implementing BOM, ABO and JET UI with frontend development experience on Oracle CPQ.
* Self-driven and must be able to work independently.
* Strong desire for continuous learning to pick new tools/technologies.
* Sense of technical ownership of the system design, development, and quality.
* Excellent documentation and communication skills
* Proactive, detail-oriented, and team-oriented
* Operate and leverage Agile and Scrum methodologies.

**Business Acumen:**

* Demonstrates the initiative to explore alternate technology and approaches to solving problems.
* Skilled in breaking down problems, documenting problem statements and estimating efforts.
* Has the ability to analyze impact of technology choices.
* Skilled in negotiation to align stakeholders and communicate a single synthesized perspective to the scrum team.

**Additional Information**
==========================

**Relocation Assistance Provided:** No

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.


Snowflake’s IT organization is seeking a Senior Salesforce Developer to join our growing team. In this role you will have the opportunity to build business applications and design features to improve the reliability of our applications and systems. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds reliable automation solutions that scale with the size and growth of the company. If you are passionate about automating the processes and you have an excellent understanding of the Salesforce platform and products (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Communities, Steelbrick CPQ, etc.), consider joining us!  

  

Reporting to our Director of IT Enterprise Sales Systems and Tools, this role will work closely with our Sales, Customer Enablement, Marketing, Finance, Engineering, Security and other business partners, as well as Executives, on Sales, Service, and Community Cloud needs.


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Build Force.com platform and cross-platform integration solutions based on industry best practices.
* Partner cross functionally with other business application owners to ensure our go to market business automation and data management process is smooth and well connected.Have an excellent understanding of underlying Force.com platform, efficient and scalable Apex, Visualforce Code, and Lightning components.
* Have a good understanding of the Event-Driven Software Architecture and experience coding event based communication.
* Assist in defining, estimating, and shaping technical solutions using best practices
* Maintain and configure our development and test instances for our internal sandboxes.
* Lead and manage the design, configuration, and deployment of our medium complexity CRM and other modules to support business automation.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
* BA/BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience.
* Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I, II highly preferred
* **Must have experience with Sales Cloud and functionalities like Accounts, Opportunities, Quotes, etc**
* Experience in designing, coding, and implementing APEX code Triggers, Classes, Components, etc, Visualforce and Lightning components, SOQL and SOSL languages.
* Deep proficiency with salesforce.com APIs and security model.
* Experience with Development Tools and technologies: Visual Studio Code (or similar IDE), Git , SVN etc.
* Experience of SDLC methodologies (Agile, SCRUM, other)
* Strong desire to learn. You are energized when new features and technologies become available and eager to understand them and maximize their potential.
* 5+ years of experience with the configuration and custom development of several Salesforce.com CRM modules. Experience integrating SFDC with multiple business applications.
* Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, Python, Javascript or other scripting language.
* Highly developed written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong attention to detail, goal-oriented.
* Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities
* Commitment to excellent customer service
* Ability to work independently

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**


* Experience in designing and implementing SFDC cross-organization along with cross-instance integrations in support of multiple business process environments.
* CRM domain knowledge with relevance to the SAAS industry and its sales and support channels.
* Demonstrated capability to develop and nurture relationships with the key stakeholders/partners.
* Salesforce Certified Platform Developer II

BONUS POINTS FOR EXPERIENCE WITH THE FOLLOWING:
* Looker
* SQL
* Statistics
* Marketo
* Data Warehousing
* Project Management

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.


Snowflake’s CRM organization is seeking a Salesforce CPQ (Steelbrick) developer to join our growing team. In this role you will have the opportunity to build business applications and design features to improve the reliability of our applications and systems. As the Salesforce CPQ developer you are responsible to translate business needs into technical specifications, design and development solutions, test and deploy them into production.


**ONSITE REQUIREMENT:**



To ensure effective collaboration and project participation, this position requires onsite presence in our Pune, India for 3 days per week.


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Technical design and implementation of Quote to Cash solutions using Salesforce CPQ
* Provide day to day CPQ platform and user support
* Document as-is and to-be architecture solutions. Present complex solutions, options and benefits to key technical program stakeholders.
* Responsible for defining, estimating, and shaping CPQ technical solutions using best practices.
* Maintain and configure our development and test instances for our internal sandboxes.
* Communicate and work effectively with cross functional teams including business teams, product teams, global IT Apps teams, consultants & vendors
* Responsible for issue resolution in UAT and post production support of CPQ functionality
* Strong desire to learn. You are energized when new features and technologies become available and eager to understand them and maximize their potential.
* Actively contribute to building and troubleshooting process automation across our Salesforce instance
* Customize as necessary in implementing scalable solutions, while advocating for best practices

**DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:**


* Bachelor's degree required in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Technology, or in a related field
* 4+ years Salesforce CPQ/ Steelbrick experience with multiple currencies and complex products
* At least 2 full cycle Salesforce CPQ project implementations
* Must have good knowledge of Salesforce CPQ objects used in Quote to Contract process
* Strong experience with SFDC Advanced approvals
* Extensive knowledge of product configuration, complex pricing rules & sequence, quote configurator plugins & Salesforce CPQ APIs
* Proficiency in various CPQ functionalities like perpetual and subscription-based licensing, various discounting models, amendments, extensions, co-terming and renewals
* Solid experience in data migration strategy, tools and processes
* Experience with quote document generation and integration with DocuSign
* Experience working with Salesforce communities, Apex, SOQL, VisualForce, Lightning, JavaScript, Eclipse IDE, WorkBench, Data Loader, Ant tool, Reports and Dashboards
* Strong working knowledge of Salesforce Objects and Data Model
* Strong understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Good interpersonal skills and strong sense of ownership
* Exposure to CLM tools and processes will be a plus


**CERTIFICATIONS:**


* Salesforce Platform Developer I must
* Salesforce Certified CPQ Specialist preferred

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.


Snowflake’s IT organization is seeking a Salesforce Business Systems Analyst to join our growing team. In this role you will have the opportunity to build business applications and design features to improve the reliability of our applications and systems.



As the Salesforce Business Systems Analyst you will be the liaison between the business stakeholders and IT. You must have the ability to translate business needs into technical specifications, design and development solutions, test and deploy them into production. You have a passion for working cross functionally and building solutions to support business process and data flows and strength in solving platform issues with expert troubleshooting skills.



Reporting to our Senior Manager, GTM systems this role will work closely with our Sales, Support, Enablement, Marketing, Finance, Engineering, Security and other business partners, as well as Executives, on Sales, Service, and Community Cloud needs.


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Implement and enhance Salesforce CPQ platform and cross-platform integration solutions based on industry best practices
* Partner cross functionally with other business application owners to ensure our go to market business automation and data management processes are smooth and well connected. Have an excellent understanding of Salesforce CPQ, Sales, Partner and cloud in classic and lightning environments.
* Expert leadership and collaboration skills with the ability to participate in any cross-functional team and build relationships with multiple stakeholders, both internally and externally with users ranging from executive to line level
* Assist in defining, estimating, and shaping technical solutions using best practices
* Lead and manage the design, configuration, and deployment of our medium complexity CRM and other modules to support sales and support automation
* Responsible for designing and implementing enterprise IT projects in Salesforce. Duties include
+ Gathering requirements from business users;
+ Working with technical leads to transform and develop Salesforce.com design and implementation documents;
+ Serve as a primary liaison between the business stakeholders and IT;
+ Define and document user interfaces and support system and data requirements;
+ Develop functional specifications and system design specifications;

**REQUIREMENTS:**


* A bachelor’s degree (preferably with an emphasis in Business Administration or Information Systems), or equivalent experience.
* Minimum 5+ years of direct experience working with Salesforce administration as a Business Systems Analyst at a firm or corporation.
* Serve as a lead subject matter expert and champion in driving the industry best practices for evolution of the company’s Saleforce.com instance and ecosystem integrated tools. Provide recommendations and assist in the creation of the strategic roadmap
* Experience with upstream & downstream processes & solutions to CRM capabilities such as MDM (Customer, contact, company, product Master), Order Management, Billing, Invoicing and Booking is a big plus.
* Experience in Sales and Service cloud application like order management, Service Contracts, Entitlement, Asset etc
* Experience in developing business process and requirements for integrating CPQ with external systems such as CRM, CLM and Workday
* Experience of SDLC methodologies (Agile, SCRUM, other)
* Highly developed written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong attention to detail, goal-oriented.
* Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities
* Ability to work independently
* Project Management experience

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**


* Experience in designing and implementing SFDC cross-organization along with cross-instance integrations in support of multiple business process environments
* CRM domain knowledge with relevance to the SAAS industry and its sales and service channels
* Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I or Salesforce Advanced Administrator or CPQ Specialist or Salesforce Consultant or any other relevant certification
* Docusign CLM
* Project Management
* ServiceNow
* Snowflake
